Here is a summary of my experience and my opinion on this property: Location – I give it a 50/50. Yes, you are semi-in the heart of downtown Seattle (but on the edge, close to the freeway). You are near shopping, businesses and the convention center BUT you are also close to the freeway so many of the rooms have “freeway view”. My room/suite actually had a combo-freeway/water view (peek-a-boo on the water side)…I honestly expected more water and less freeway for what I was paying. Now, you don’t really hear the freeway too much but you do get to look at it depending on where your room is. For a comparable price, there are several hotels in the area with much better views that are much closer to the water and sites. Charm – There is not much “charm” to this hotel but I don’t know that is the objective either. It’s fairly corporate with clean lines but so many properties in downtown Seattle have special touches like wine tasting in the lobby, fireplaces in room, etc. where they really make it feel special (think the Monaco, or Mayflower or Vintage Park, etc.). Food - Well yes there is a Ruth Chris on property but while that is a nice high end place, it’s a chain. Give me something with true “Seattle” personality. Seattle is such a “foodie” town, I can go to Ruth Chris in any major city in the U.S. Rooms – The best part is the bathroom in my opinion hand’s down. Spacious, modern, clean, etc. Sure that’s great, but how much are you really in there? The bedrooms while fairly standard for Hyatt and most the chains these days (comfortable beds, flatscreens, etc.) the furniture was a little worn. Some of my furniture had lots of nicks and scrapes. Additionally the "attractive leather" chair at the desk was not adjustable nor that comfortbale so I could not really utilize the desk in comfort as I could with an ergonomic chair many hotels provide these days. The bedroom portion of the room itself reminded me a bit of the size you find in NYC at a “W” or something similar. There is not much area between the bed and wall/dressers so if two of you are trying to pass to get to the door or bath at the same time, it will be tight. Realistically that is not untypical for an urban hotel but in many of the Seattle downtown properties, they appear to be a bit more generous in the size of the bedroom itself (in this case, a decent amount of square footage goes to the bathroom). Perhaps it was just the layout or usage of the square footage but I was not that excited about it. Gym – Well I am always fairly happy with the Hyatt facilities for their gym and one of the reasons I come back. Maintaining a workout on the road is important to me and they are always well equipped, clean and spacious and are more like a real “gym” than just a small “fitness room” that many properties offer. All that being said, I probably won’t come back to this particular Hyatt. I think Seattle has a lot more “interesting” properties in this price range and location with special touches you just don’t get at the larger corporate chains. Ahhh….consistent but boring.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: clifton2a
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again while visiting family over Thanksgiving and it's still my favourite in Seattle the staff are great and very friendly especially David who couldn't do enough for us. I think the views are the best straight down Pine to the Market & Water and from the side out over to the Space needle which my young Son loved Great location for shopping and some nice restaraunts close by also

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving weekend downtown”
Reviews.Author: YC-YVR
Reviews.Content: Booked as a last minute flight/hotel pkg through Travelocity. Friendly & knowledgeable front desk staff (esp. Paul the concierge). Immaculate modern room with a view up Pine St. to the water (and the just-lit Macy's tree). Incredible bathroom. Ruth's Chris Steakhouse is in the hotel (and apparently is the only one in the chain to also serve breakfast). Great service and delicious steaks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rogjaminov
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked this hotel for a fun weekend away. I usually have good luck with hotels in Seattle, but this place is phenomenal. Not only is it modern and very comfortable (the beds are incredible), but the location can't be beat. It's right in the heart of the shopping district downtown and there are plenty of great restaurants nearby (try the Metropolitan Grill for happy hour). The room we stayed in had electric blinds that virtually black out the room, so you won't be woken up by the light creeping through the curtains. And when you eventually wake up, naturally there's a Starbucks in the lobby. I've stayed in some good hotels in Seattle, but I'll return to the Hyatt next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: milboj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights when in Seattle for a wedding. After a 30+ hour trip from Australia it was heaven. The bed was huge and comfy, the bathroom beautiful and the staff really helpful and friendly. The room was very clean, and linen and towels changed daily. Not the mention the great location... If ever in Seattle do not hesitate to stay here or recommend it to someone else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent center city hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyWeekender
Reviews.Content: A beautiful centrally-located hotel in downtown Seattle. Has a modern norhwest contemporary feel with use of beautiful wood paneling, furntiure, and natural colors. The rooms are spacious, each with a with plasma TV and extra large marble bathroom. All rooms are floors 10-28, so I assume that all have excellent views. Located within a couple blocks of excellent shopping, restaurants, and theaters. Pike Place market about 7 blocks west. Vicinty of hotel is a comfortable area to walk during the day and evening hours. The new hotel fitness center is spacious, has modern new equipment, and its mirrored walls and beautiful wood paneling throughout give it a rich and spacious feel.. I travel regularly for business, and this is a special hotel that I would recommend to anyone who needs to stay in downtown Seattle. We live nearby in Bellevue, so this was a special weekend getaway stay in Seattle with friends. The rates were very competitive, and we all enjoyed our stay.. (Starbucks adjacent to lobby is handy for our morning coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: maydull
Reviews.Content: This is was the nicest, best hotel I have ever stayed at. Everything...room, view, service, location, was perfect. Five stars, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Property and Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnTes
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my 2-night stay at the Grand Hyatt-Seattle. The location is terrific and the rooms are luxurious and spacious. There was a problem with the heating (as in, no heat would come out) but the maintenance staff came up immediately to fix it and everything else was perfect. I was in a corner room on the 24th floor and the views were amazing. I previously stayed at the Grand Hyatt-Seattle a few times and can't wait for my next opportunity to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: travelerinva
Reviews.Content: After extensive research into the hotel options in downtown Seattle, we booked at the Grand Hyatt. We wanted to be within walking distance to everything and this was in a great location for all the sights. We booked directly through hyatt.com and got a great AAA rate ($230/night avg for a corner suite) for 4 nights (Sat-Wed). When we arrived, we were told we had been upgraded (we hadn't even thought to ask for an upgrade) to an executive suite. Our suite was on the 28th floor--almost at the top, the view was great and the suite was very spacious, clean and had a lot of extras. There were 2 bathrooms (1 and a half really), the main bathroom had a great soaking tub, a glass shower with 2 shower heads and wonderful robes. There were 2 flat screen TVs--one in the bedroom and one in the "living room", a refrigerator, a great coffee maker and an iPod dock. We really couldn't have asked for a better place to stay! We also had our 5 month old baby with us and they provided a nice crib, soft blanket, extra towels and lots of baby bath products and a rubber ducky! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Febo17
Reviews.Content: This is a nice modern hotel in downtown Seattle. The common areas are all very clean and first rate. The gym is above average by hotel standards, complete with sauna, whirlpool and steam room. My room was clean with a comfortable bed and nice flat screen tv. The room itself was a bit on the small side but okay for a night or two. The bathroom on the other hand was quite roomy and very nice. The shower water pressure in my particular room was below average. The rooms facing east are adjacent to a residential building so I mostly kept the blinds closed. If I were to stay at this hotel again, I would request a room with a view to the west or south. The hotel is conveniently located downtown around many shops and restaurants. Pike Place Market is about a 5 or 6 block walk. Overall, this is a good choice for business travellers to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Decor and the Views!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJana
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Hyatts I've stayed in! The location is great (in downtown Seattle - very close to all the shopping) and the views of the sound are amazing from the top floors. We stayed on the 22nd floor with a view of the sound but also had a view of the space needle. Definitely ask for a room on one of the top floors - they upgraded us at no cost. The gym here is wonderful - complete w steam room, sauna, and hot tub. Its pretty large for a hotel gym with an extensive collection of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic at the Grand Hyatt Seattle”
Reviews.Author: smiles2Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days and can't think of a single thing that wasn't great! The room was very clean and up to date. The bathroom was amazing - you can live in there alone! :) The staff was always pleasant. It was within walking distance to so many things including Pike's Market, the Space Needle, and Pilgrim's Square. It's the hotel with a level of excellence to beat!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit not as good as the 1st”
Reviews.Author: KiwisLA
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel in Feb 08 and gave it a great review. However we experienced a number of problems this time which detracted from their previous service. We made a booking for a room with 2 beds, one for us and one for our teenager. They turned out to be very small double beds, (almost incapable of holding two grown adults), not queens which are the usual size in most upscale hotels of this category. Unfortunately they were also very uncomfortable which is strange as we have found Hyatt beds so comfortable previously we even considered buying one! Secondly our room had a connecting door to the next room. There was a lock for safety, unfortunately it didn't stop any noise which meant that we could hear every conversation, cough and pin drop next door. Thirdly when we tried to fill the bath the plug would not work and the bath drained quicker than it was filling. Unfortunately we only found this out at 11pm on our first night. After reporting it next morning it was mended before 6pm. It meant that we only had a chance to use the bath on one of our two nights stay, which was a bit of a let down. Fourthly, when we tried to arrange a later checkout they could not accommodate us. Odd as we didn't have a problem the previous time we stayed, even though we booked the room on points on both occasions. Lastly, when we went down to catch a taxi to the airport there was no porter to be seen anywhere. We were jumped on by two taxi drivers parked in the loop who ended up heatedly arguing over us in the middle of the Grand Hyatt driveway/lobby door area. Not exactly the behavior expected in a hotel of this class. A porter should be there at all times to organise transport, baggage, etc and to assist guests of the hotel We ended up walking onto the street to hail another taxi to avoid the argument. Our experience this time means we will reconsider our accommodation options during our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet stay”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GHS on the last night of our two week trip out west. I had high hopes for the hotel from the TA writeups and it did not disappoint. Following the tips posted earlier, we booked a corner suite. What a spectacular view of the city and the automatic blinds are certainly cool. I loved the room. Am a world traveller and this room was done 'just so'. Very tastefully done. Eat at Ruth's Chris in the lobby. We went to some forgetable Asian place. You are only four blocks from Pike Place market here, so the location cannot be beat. A small ding to the overall experience is that the carpets throughout the common areas of the hotel need to be replaced or deeply cleaned. Am I picking nits here? Yes. Stay here in a heartbeat. It's the best in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “I always love a Hyatt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suellen1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived a day early for our cruise to Alaska. I tried to find a centralized hotel where everything would be within walking distance of the hotel. We were greeted outside the hotel by very friendly hotel staff. The simple expression by the hotel staff to greet me by my name is well worth my visit. The hotel room was clean and very comfortable. The bell hop made it a point to go over everything in our room, give us his name and make a quick get away. The hotel was in a perfect place to walk Pikes Place, the Space Needle and all the shopping venues around the hotel. The martini bar around the corner offered some really good Bloody Mary's and buffet breakfast. Very impressed by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hyatt in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyHHHHH
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle for a conference at the Convention Center. The hotel was fabulous. Very atttentive staff, clean rooms, very nice lobby. Ruth's Chris lobby restaurant was great. The gym was very nice and updated. The hot tub, sauna and steam room were awesome. The convention center was only 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt Seattle as perfect as you can get!”
Reviews.Author: AHumphreys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! Elegant decor, very quiet, upscale, with attentive staff who seemed genuinely interested in your stay. Rooms were large with granite countertops, separate bath and shower, truly exquisite furnishings. We had a lovely view of the bay and the Tower. The hotel is one block from convention center, surrounded by incredible shopping and restaurants, and within walking distance of Pike Market. We would definitely go back and only wish we could do so immediately! It is comparable to any Ritz Carlton we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: niente14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. Before arrival, the concierge e-mails and offers to help with any needs you may have. I had him make dinner reserevations at Ruth's Chris and The Georgian at the Fairmont . He e-mailed me the reservations. At check in, we were informed that we were upgraded to a King Corner Suite on the 19th floor. We were also handed a envelope with the dinner reservations and a map with the restaurants locations. The view from our suite was fantastic. Looking west was the view of the water, north the Space Needle. Location, location, location. It does not get any better then the Hyatt. The first night we dined at Ruth's Chris, the waiter told us that the concierge was treating us to an appetizer. How nice. Of course the food was delicious. The suite was very clean, bed super comfortable, and the bathroom spacious with the beautiful white marble. We travel extensively as we are retired. The staff at the Hyatt are some of the best we have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Quiet & Comfortable Stay at the Seattle Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: SeminarTrekker
Reviews.Content: Flying into SEATAC, I purchased previously online a roundrip ticket for the Grayline Airporter. You catch the downtown bus at door 00. The large bus drops you right off in front of the Grand Hyatt on 7th and picks you up there as well. Since my business was near downtown, I did not need a auto rental. My check in was warm and welcoming by one of the most cheerful Hyatt folks in a long time - Jen. More properties need employees such as Jen. My room was not available so I dropped off my luggage and walked over to the Westlake Center and took the Monorail to the Seattle Center. Purchased some souvenirs at the Space Needle. Returned to the Westlake Center and ate lunch at their food court which was not bad (Thai food vendor). My room was a corner room and I had a special group rate, that was better than the Renaissance and the rates at the Marriott Waterfront properties. The corner room has plenty of natural light via the floor to ceiling windows. The T.V. room offers a desk, minibar, T.V., loveseat and chair. I have to admit as some previous reviewers stated, these chairs are uncomfortable. Strictly for the look. Whoever purchased they chairs were not thinking of their guests comfortability. Amazing, a hospitality business and they do not test out the chairs but probably went for price. Thankfully that was only bad thing about the room and my stay at this property. As mentioned in other reviews there a very nice marble bathroom with both shower and tub. Plenty of closet space in the hall seperating the front room from the bedroom. A lucky bamboo in the front foyer is a nice touch! The water temperature and pressure were fine. The cleaning was excellent each day I was there. The bed was comfortable and room was quiet from outside street noise and across the way construction. Could not hear other room noise as well. I used the well equipped gym which was busy most mornings and including some rude guests as well, ready to jump on your exercise machine when you're getting some water. I ate several breakfasts at the Ruth Chris Steakhouse, attached to this property. Service was always excellent! One breakfast was excellent and the other good. I also ate one dinner there and the steak was excellent and side dishes tasty and service excellent. Expensive though. There are no cheap diners nearby...but there is Cheese Cake Factory; Daily Grille and Starbucks within a block of the property. This property is easy walk to Westlake Mall and Center. And is not too far and walkable to the Pike Place Marketplace. This being August, the weather was a bit warm and sunny. I took two tours during my time in Seattle. The Seattle Mini Bus tour with a every a good looks and stops around the city and it's districts. The driver tour guide was highly knowledgble and warm. Most folks on the tour were returning from Alaska cruise ship tours which is Big business in Seattle now since 9/11 and less business in Vancouver, Canada. I highly recommend the Pike Public Market food tour. Excellent and attentive guide. With some much insight and context, it makes your walking around the interesting Pike Market much more enjoyable. You wear ear sets & and receivers so you can hear the guide. Plus the food samples were very good! I highly recommend the Pike vendors: MarketSpice; Pike Place Fish (yummy salmon); Frank's Quality Produce; Pike Place "New England" Chowder; Chukar Cherries (tasty); Beecher'shandmade Cheese; Piroshky Piroshky; and Etta's Seafood. Right before my Pike Market food tour. I checked the local weather forecast on t.v. The news person said expect more than you typical Seattle summer rain and bring an umbrella if you're going to be out and about in the afternoon. I was only one of a few that morning walking around the market with a umbrella but by the afternoon. It began raining hard and many were caught unguarded and very wet! I also recommend Ivar's Seafood along the waterfront. Seattle also offers free public transportation, and i took the bus to and from the International District and visited a well stocked Asian market called Uwajimaya. I enjoyed my visit to the Emerald city, and the Grand Hyatt provided a great base to do some business and take in some sights in this great cultural and progressive city in the Northwest! I highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveled20yo
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is awsome. Everything downtown is walkable, and if it's raining they have umbrellas you may borrow from your room. No need for a car really if you are there for only a few days. Staff is wonderful! I was in a corner room on a lower floor but my view was still wonderful. The bathrooms are spacious, with a stand alone shower and a soaking tub. This hotel is quite the oasis in a very busy part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've found in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Traveller98245
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 2 year old daughter, travel to Seattle frequently for short 2 or 3 day visits. We have tried many hotels and have finally decided that we can't do any better than the Grand Hyatt. We usually get a Corner Suite or an Emerald Suite. I'll admit that it's a bit pricey, but we're very picky about cleanliness and comfort when it comes to hotels and we're willing to pay extra to get those. The Hyatt delivers! The suites we have been in were exactly what the website made them out to be, and the bathrooms have to be seen to be believed. Lastly, our daughter cheers and claps when we pull up to the entrance, and she loves talking about the rubber ducks that housekeeping puts in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown and up there with the best of them”
Reviews.Author: Photopedia
Reviews.Content: I spent a single night here with my family at the end of our vacation in Alaska. I've stayed in many large city hotels in the US over the years and the Grand Hyatt compares favourably with the best of them. First impressions are not good. Although the hotel is very central and in an excellent position for downtown shopping, the exterior looks cramped and dark. Once you get into the lobby, however, it's a different matter.... The decor is sumptuous and muted in style. The standard rooms are huge. They almost feel like suites. Although the hotel is six years old, it has worn extremely well. The spa / gymnasium is tight for space but is well equipped including a jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. The food and service in Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, which adjoins the hotel, was excellent and I can strongly recommend it. All the staff were extremely helpful and efficient. All in all, a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigAlFromDaBronx
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, and I mean everything. The staff was great, the view was good, and the amenities were top notch. Unfortunately, this year the prices went through the roof, so I had to stay elsewhere, which was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: themonstersmom
Reviews.Content: Wow what a hotel. We traveled there to see some friends that were in Seattle. This is the hotel they stayed at so we did to. This is by far the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at! When we checked in they said our room had been upgraded, super. When the bell hop looked at our room number even he was excited and said that was one of the best rooms in the place! He wasn't kidding! We basically had a 2 room, 1.5 bath apartment. My son was impressed with the bathroom, that he decided was bigger than his bedroom and he was right. We had an amazing view of the city including the Space Needle. The living room had plenty of sitting area, a wet bar, bathroom and large plasma TV. the bedroom had a nice king size bed, desk and another plasma TV. There was a full walk in closet (wish I had that at home). The bathroom was amazing, all done in marble, with a huge soaker tub and seperate glass shower (with dual showerheads). There was also a digital scale and small TV in the bathroom. The windows in each room were covered with automatic room darkening shades, I never wanted to close them because the view was so great yet my son couldn't keep himself from opening and closing them! They have a state of the art fitness room with jacuzzi tub. As one would expect in Seattle there is a Starbucks downstairs and a large gift shop. We never did eat in the fancy restaurant so I can not comment on that. This hotel is within walking distance to most everything you would need to do. If you are up for a long walk you could even walk to the baseball or football stadiums. This hotel is not cheap and is tough on a tight budget. I did lots of checking before booking this place and hotels in the Seattle area in general are expensive. After our stay I had less of an issue with the cost. We would stay here again no question about it!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Tonyeng
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with fantastic room, friendly and helpful staff. Great location. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “A Luxury Experience”
Reviews.Author: BTL180
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt on a weekend trip to Seattle and loved it. It was close walking distance to the market and other downtown shopping. The hotel staff was helpful and the room was incredible. The bathroom was huge with a large tub and a separate walk in shower. The beds were comfortable and the views of Seattle were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed weekend”
Reviews.Author: Airlea
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spotless, great decor, and friendly staff. I stayed for 3 nights and was impressed by most things. It was out of my budget range but I splurged and overall it was worth it. I found parking was very expensive. I drove around the block 3 times before I realized there was a section of a parkade for the hotel. From what I could tell, there wasn't any other option for parking in that area. You could do the valet parking for a few dollars more than what it would cost to park your car in the parkade. I should have done this because you get in and out as many times as you want, whereas the other option is to pay each time you leave the parkade.... by the end of the weekend, that ended up costing me more. You couldn't really hear outside noise however the actual hotel room doors SLAMMED shut. They are heavy and you can literally FEEL when someone's doors shut if their room is near yours. Not the greatest thing to wake up to throughout the night. However, the bed made up for that as it was very comfortable. Didn't have much of a view as we were on the 26th floor and facing west. We didn't spend much time in the hotel room so it did not matter. If you're looking for a view, you're going to have to go to higher floors and find out which direction the room faces. The area is where you can walk to almost everything in the downtown core. The walk to the Pike Place Market was very nice however there are many pan-handlers throughout the whole downtown core. Unfortunately you will find that no matter where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: spnslc
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by this hotel. We had a very nice three-night, four-day stay at the Hyatt. It has nicely decorated rooms (we had a mini-suite with an adjoining double room) and they were very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was great and the area is very walkable, too. There are all kinds of shopping areas and restaurants surrounding the hotel. We stay in 5-star hotels almost exclusively and we chose this hotel based on past reviews. We have actually stayed at many 5-star hotels that have not been as nice, or as clean, or had such a friendly staff as this hotel. It is always a pleasure when a hotel can get it ALL together for their customers!

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: durreyk
Reviews.Content: recent stay here. corner suite, very nice. 23rd floor. big room and clean. contemporary. only noise is sirens duing the nite. big city life! gym is great for a hotel. nice and new. weight, elip, tm, bikes. all recent. check out the nearby ruth-chris steakhouse and ask for dee. as advertised, he was great. offering alot of very helpful suggestions. seattle and the market is very crowded. but it is within a 5 block walk, self park in the garage behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMartinOriginals
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt in downtown Seattle was beautiful to say the least. The shuttle from the airport took me directly there. The location of the hotel was great, as it was right in the middle of downtown. An easy 15-20 min walk to the waterfront was convenient. Buses all over the streets were easy to take and navigate. The hotel itself is immense. The lobby is huge upon entering the front doors. The rooms are too extravagant and huge. The bathroom was about 3 times the size of any already huge hotel bathroom. It had a separate tub that could fit at least 3 people in it, a shower, and in between that a huge amount of space. The beds had down comforters and 6 pillows. The view was amazing. I could see the entire downtown scenery from the 12th floor. The closet was huge and contained a spare umbrella, 2 bathrobes, and more. Very quiet hotel as well. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They gave me a useful map and always helped me out with information about buses and public transportation. I would recommend this hotel to anybody in the world. You must come experience this!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidou99
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent contemporary hotel in a great location in Seattle. We stayed on a combination of business and leisure in May 2007 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Grand Hyatt. The room is small but clean and nicely furbished. The bathroom is spacious and has luxurious feel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CalP0ly
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at The W hotel in Seattle but now stay at this Hyatt. Beautiful rooms, great decor, some sides of the building do have a water view, great location, easy to walk down to the Pike Market, excellent shopping and sightseeing. My only compliant was the Asian gentleman working the front desk who refused to print my boarding passes after the printer on the self serve Boarding Pass Kiosk failed, I politely asked the other Gentleman working at the front desk and he immediately printed the boarding passes for us. Excellent Property for Business or Tourist Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Location OK, but darker than Darth Vader”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler57
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt and was struck by how dark and dingy this supposedly four-star hotel is. The Starbucks in the lobby was probably one of the least inviting spots in this mecca for coffee. The staff was friendly but there is no view, difficult and expensive parking and difficult access unless you're a cabbie and know the city. There's no pool, and ugly architecture. Seattle Hyatt ain't so Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and great location”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalguy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic getaway during the Easter weekend. I really enjoyed my stay here. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The room was very large and well furnished. Our bathroom was extremely large and contained both a bathtub and a shower stall. The fitness room was top of the line. The hotel is very close to the Pike Place Market and only a short monorail ride from Seattle Center and the Space Needle. Our bed was very comfortable and we are even considering buying one from their catalogue. I would recommend this hotel to any type of traveller since I can't see anybody being disappointed in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: JS27
Reviews.Content: We're locals, and booked an event in the Onyx Room. The location of the hotel is ideal, and the hotel itself and room were great, but we knew all this coming in. What pushes this from a "good" to "excellent" rating was the staff/service. Everyone we dealt w/ was friendly, helpful, and had a sense of humor. If we ever get to plan another event or just want to spend the night someplace where we treated like royalty, this hotel is the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Briandw
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt Seattle is a must-stay hotel in Seattle. Nothing to complain. Great location, facility and service as well. When we checked in, our assigned room was found to be "Not Ready". Bell desk rep who helped us with luggage instantaneously guided us to new room and offered 'Club Hyatt' access to compensate the inconvenience we might had. Everything was clean and neat, and Starbucks is in the building(Of course, it's Seattle) Highly recommended !!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Great service & location”
Reviews.Author: MzChitown
Reviews.Content: Located near shops, food, and fun. Service was fantastic and the room was above par. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in downtown Seattle, service uneven”
Reviews.Author: thehungerfortravel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend away at the Grand Hyatt-Seattle. Here is my breakdown of the hotel. Pro's- 1) Able to check in early, arrived at 12 pm and the front desk graciously let us check-in. She even had a smile on her face and was very professional 2) Ruth's Chris has a tremendous happy hour menu and is attached to the lobby of the Hyatt. Great place and SO much better than the usual hotel restaurants 3) The bathrooms are incredible. My room on the 20th floor had both a bathtub and walk in shower. 4) The 32 inch LG LCD tv was a plus 5) The beds are very comfortable. (but not as great as the Marriot beds) 6) The concierge Scott was a good guy and very helpful Con's 1) Upon check-out, my friend asked the bell-hop to bring the bags out of the temporary storage to him. He brought the 3 bags to him while I was at the Concierge and it looked as if the bags were just dropped down in a reckless manner. Also, the porter didn't offer to help us with our bags to the cab and just went back to 'stand at attention'. The experience only affirms my belief that it's best to always handle your own bags at all times. 2) There were two staff members 'standing at attention' in the lobby, but NOT opening doors or offering to help you with your bags in a gracious way. I was reminded of the Vegas 'tip for everything' mentality rather than feeling that the staff was genuinely eager to help. I tend to appreciate when people are a bit more pro-active.

Reviews.Title: “Cost up front and cancellation fee”
Reviews.Author: visio4
Reviews.Content: When you book with this hotel they require full prepayment and is subject to special cancellation penalty. We had a family emergency and had to cancel our trip which was bad enough and then were hit with a fee.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: biosdh
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night on 2/16. We are locals who just came into the city to break up a long weekend with our teen. I booked this hotel based on our teen wanting to stay in a "large" hotel. I booked the Emerald Suite and was not disappointed. It was a beautiful room with sweeping views of Lake Union and the Sound. I asked for an early check in and we arrived at 3 only to find out our room wasn't ready. So....we used the valet and decided to walk around town. The three of us were headed down seventh avenue when we heard this amazing ROAR.... I was stunned as my car (a Porsche) was going from 0-100 in a half of a block to the parking garage in front of me. Our fourteen year old is standing there going "Mom, that's your car"...my husband is in stunned silence and not a happy camper. I talked to the night manager who said that they "contract" their valet parking out and that sometimes the garage is full. Total bologne as this had nothing to do with that. A punk took my car out and rodded it. I am not at all happy with how management handled this situation....free parking? Yes. But..how unprofessional to drive someone's car like that? I ordered champagne and strawberries as it was my husband's birthday...nothing was there so I had to call and ruin the "surprise". All in all...I would go to Hotel 1000 or Hotel Andra over this place after our experience with service. The location is good for shopping but had I not used Hyatt points I would have been even more vocal. The icing on the cake was when the valet on Sunday said..."Mamm, we don't hot rod cars"....so he called me and my family liars as we watched my car fly down the road. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelRevue
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a business trip. This was a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Seattle. Check-in was easy. Room was large and very comfortably furnished. Bed and linens provided a great nights rest. The bathrooms was outstanding. Large and clean, the bathroom had one of the largest stand-up shower I've ever used. Flat screen tv was a great touch and the chair/ottoman was a great place to unwind and watch the tv. I ordered room service and was satisfied, although, like many hotels, was very pricey. Location is great - walking distance to everything in town and Pike Place and either a good walk or short cab to Belltown and all the bars and restaurants located there. I would definitely consider the Grand Hyatt for my next Seattle visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RichardJenkins
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Grand Hyatt was for 6 nights. The hotel is nicely situated right on the edge of Downtown - close enough to be within easy walking distance of all the main attractions, but just far enough out to be in a quiet location. The rooms are pretty standard considering the price, but nicely furnished and clean all the same, with comfortable beds. The marble bathroom however is very impressive with a separate bath and shower. The hotel restaurant had a good, reasonably priced breakfast choice, but I wouldn't recommend eating here in the evening - had a very average steak and the service wasn't very good either. Another complaint is that internet access isn't free (and is actually really expensive), and the "Business Center" consists of only one computer! These are just minor gripes though which didn't spoil a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “pure elegance”
Reviews.Author: flyingboy
Reviews.Content: the grand hyatt.... simply one of the most beautiful i ve ever stayed in .. the location: right in the heart of downtown seattle a huge and luxurious lobby the hotel is big but yiou do not feel it it remains a rather very quiet hotel and the staff is very helpful and friendly the room: big with a great bed and for many rooms a magnificient view of the city luxurious and modern furniture the bathroom: the best !!!! very big beautiful design and materials i d love to add some bad points to this hotel but i haven't seen any.... well maybe the breakfast with no buffet but that isn 't a big problem ( for buffet lovers avoid the hotel for the breakfast ) and the room service is quite expensive as well julien from france

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: lsdaloia
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews on tis site, we stayed at the Hyatt 11/30-12/2. It is a great property in downtown Seattle. Barney's, Nordstrom's and lots of other shopping is within two blocks. It is a short walk to Pike Market. The staff was incredible. When we got back to the hotel Saturday afternoon, the room still wasn't made up. We called downstairs and let housekeeping know we were going to the gym, and needed the room made up right away. No problem! Our requests for ice, towels, etc were handled promptly and courteously. We had a corner room, which was big. However, I'm not sure I'd book another room like this, since you have to keep the curtains closed to block out light from the street (not to mention for privacy). My husband and I both worked out at the gym. They have everything you can imagine there -- freeweights, weight machines, ellipticals, bikes, treadmills, etc. They even have exercise balls and body bars. They had more equipment in the gym than any other hotel I've stayed at, including a Four Seasons. We will definitely stay at the Hyatt again the next time we're in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ybgdess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final 3 nights of our 5 day anniversary trip. My husband and I were highly impressed with the front desk staff, especially the concierge - who by the way, recommended great restaurants. Our travel agent must have requested two queen beds, but when we checked in they saw it was our anniversary and asked if we wanted a king. Of course we did! And they were very happy to oblige and we ended up in a great room with a king bed. The view from the room was great - although there was a lot of construction going on. The bathroom was immaculate and I loved the turn down service every night (including a bucket of ice AND chocolates on the pillow!!) We loved the location of The Hyatt - we parked the car and walked everywhere. It was so close to anything you'd want to see - Pike's Market, shopping, The Underground, the waterfront and ferry's, etc. It was also close to a lot of great restaurants. The concierge recommended Wild Ginger to us (a Pan-Asian restaurant). It was FABULOUS! We absolutely loved it - but get reservations ahead of time or you may be waiting for awhile. There is also a cheesecake factory around the block, which we liked because it was something familiar for that first day. Ruth's Steakhouse is attached to the hotel and we ordered from their our last night and brougt to our room. We weren't very hungry but didn't want to be starving at midnight, so we ordered their lobster bisque and some BBQ shrimp. I'm sorry to say I was severely disappointed. How hard is it to make those things? I didn't enjoy them at all! I wish we had just dragged ourselves out of our room to go to a restaurant, but we were exhausted from our day of walking around. The biggest complaint I had was the cost of parking. It was absolutely ridiculous. Although, I'm assuming most downtown hotels would be about the same. We pre-paid for the hotel before we left, so we weren't expecting much of a bill. We did get Wild Hogs on demand in the room ($14.99 for a movie?!?), but other than that the only thing on our bill was parking and the cost came out over $100 for 3 nights! We were shocked. I believe it was $31 plus several taxes per night to park. The parking is really the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5. Anyway, the hotel was very clean and comfortable and the staff was very nice. The location is superb and I would definitely stay here again (but I would look at using a car service to and from the airport so to not pay the ridiculous parking fee).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Seattle hotels”
Reviews.Author: washington_wahine
Reviews.Content: We had a third visit to the Grand Hyatt, once again for business. It's proximity to the Convention Center is great, and this hotel is much nicer than the Sheraton which is a wee bit closer. We have had excellent, exemplary service here and appreciate it in this current environment. We booked an Executive suite with an adjoining room, which happened to be another corner suite. The combination is great for a family. The Executive suite has a small bar with sink, refrigerator, etc, as well as a second bathroom off of the sitting area. The corner suite has a work area, a long hallway, then a bedroom with wall to floor windows on 2 walls. Bathrooms have great soaking tubs with waterfall faucets, separate dressing areas, and aveda amenities. We were on the concierge floor, with access to a lounge with concierge (very nice and helpful lady), internet service, good breakfast, sodas, fruit, water, and hot snacks, a good cheese selection and drinks at night. There's always espresso, coffee and mochas available as well, which is a favorite in our family. Room service is quick and efficient. The location, again, is good for the convention center or shopping. There are many good restaurants within walking distance, and if you don't want to eat breakfast in the concierge lounge try to get the b and b package; it includes a hearty breakfast in the adjacent Ruth's Chris steakhouse. Parking is expensive, valet or self, but that's unfortunately par for Seattle. The furniture is a bit worn, with the occasional stained pillow or scraped desk. The bed was very bad, the worst I've slept on in a long time - had we been there longer I would have requested some kind of stabilizing board under the mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kpieper876
Reviews.Content: I stay in Seattle a few times every month. I have had the opportunity to stay at several hotels on the Tripadvisor list, from cheap to boutique. For the money, the Hyatt Grand is the best deal. It has the nicest amenities and friendly staff. The hotel is excellently furbished and has a 24 hour gym.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: AustinWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed first week of Oct. in an Emerald Suite. Awesome views, clean, quiet room, comfortable bed, large sitting area, bedroom & bathroom. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The Steakhouse on site is excellent. Ate there for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Hotel located within walking distance to Pike's Market, shopping, restaurants, etc. I guess the only negative is pulling into the hotel because the space is small and tight so it easily becomes congested. However, valet does a great job keeping the cars and taxi's out of the area. Our experience could not have been any better. This is an awesome place and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't honor 2 double bed reservation”
Reviews.Author: DLP1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice area, except at night, when there are lots of homeless who show up a block or two away. Staff are friendly, but they refused to honor my 2 double bed reservation. They did offer a cot, but when you are on a business trip, it is hard to decide which person should stay in a cot at a 5 star hotel. If you need a guaranteed room type (1 or 2 beds), this hotel is not for you. Otherwise, if you feel lucky, give it a try...

Reviews.Title: “Another "Hooray !" for the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: quiltlover
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel: friendly staff, comfortable room and fantastic location. I agree with all the former posters in many ways. We liked to be on the 23 rd floor. We had a great city view and it was just perfect to sit on the comfy armchair, put the legs on a foot stool and enjoy the view after a busy day in the city. And the bathroom - all positive reviews are true! And the fluffy bathrobes were a special treat!! Thanks to TA we choose the Grand Hyatt and we did enjoy the very central location very much. Pikes Place was an easy walk and lots of stores and restaurants were close (we did not eat at the restaurant within the hotel - I am vegetarian and steakhouses are not my first choice - Ha!!). WI-Fi was via T-mobil and did cost 9.90 a day. This is the only thing that was not a pleasure in the hotel. At lots of other places it is free and should be here,too. But still 5 points from us. We would like to come back and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: OldCritical
Reviews.Content: I used the tripadvisor ratings, and chose the Grand Hyatt in downtown Seattle for a four day stay in that city. There were four of us, so I booked 2 rooms. There was very little difference between the two rooms. The rooms were well maintained, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was a pleasure, and the breakfast in the on site Ruth Chris's Steakhouse was excellent. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A well located and furnished hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Ghost
Reviews.Content: We came for a wedding of a childhood friend of my fiance's. Just to let you know, we had a choice this year for vacation spots between Chicago and Seattle. This year we chose Chicago since we were coming here for the wedding. While Chicago was fun, our stay at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle made Seattle a much more pleasant stay and us envying that we didn't vacation here. Getting to the Hyatt is easy, just by a ticket on the Grey line bus. Bus ticket and terminal is at the end of the airport dear door 00. It was a long walk for use but the trip bus ride was easy and convienent. The Grand Hyatt's location is great. Its 4-5 blocks to Pike's Market, 3 blocks to the Monorail. Our room did not have a direct view of the water but you could still see the water if you looked out the window and to the left a bit. We were only there for a couple of nights, but shopping was close at hand and the SciFi museum was fun. The Experience Music Project was a bit of a let down but came free with the SciFi museum ticket. We didn't go in the space needle. $16 per person to ride an elevator? No thanks. The monorail was cheap at $2 each way ($4 round trip). Pike's market was lively and colorful with the food and flower venders. Wished we stayed another night or two to visit Pioneer square and some other attractions. If you forget anything, the hotel's lobby store is well equiped but then again great shopping venues are only a block or two away. For food, I'd suggest going to Ruth's for breakfast. It was fairly hearty and tasted good. You should also try Cafe Campagne down the road near Pike's market. the food is country french and excellent. The road is also good for picture taking (big public market sign easily viewable) and is a straight shot from the hotel (exit left from the hotel's main entrance). The rooms were fairly spacious. My only sore point is the drawer space for clothes. There were four small drawers available. While usable they were still a bit small. This however was not as bad a situation as could be given that the closet was fairly large with plenty of hangers and a cubical style shelf for storing clothing. Basically, you have enough space for two people to store clothing for about a week. The bathroom was large and well accomodated. Marble flooring and nice counter top space allowed for me and my fiance to spread our toilettries out. The room came with both shower and bath and the bath filled quickly and easily. A standard coffee maker was avaiable but why would anyone bother with hotel in room coffee is beside me since Starbucks is downstairs and thier restaurant is fairly upscale. The television is a stand 29" and kind of low end for a hotel but then again, no one really comes to a hotel just to watch TV. Standard minifridge and bar avaiable but not used. I kind of wonder why hotels keep providing these things since I haven't known anyone who would use them. Net connection runs from $7-$10 a day depending on connectivity and options. Wireless is through T-Mobile but they do have wired connections. Decor was kind of Modern Italian and the picts of the room should give you a good idea. The bed was very comfortable, just the right combination of softness and yet firm enough where you didn't feel like you were sinking into the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option”
Reviews.Author: Trav1964
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise. I stayed in this hotel because I was attending a conference. The rooms are great…and I am picky. The bathroom was nice with granite/marble (who can tell the difference anymore). Bed was great. Nice size room. Really nothing negative to say. I am typically a boutique hotel kind of guy for vacation, but if you are looking for a nice hotel in downtown Seattle, this is not a bad option. I stayed at the W before I moved to this hotel. I liked this hotel better than the W. Quite a statement coming from someone who has stayed at several W hotels around the world and recommend them. If the rate is decent, consider this option. It is typically that big hotel feel, but worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: milomannn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 4 days during a conference. The room was one of the best we have had. It was spacious, well appointed and had a glorious view over Seattle (24th floor). But what we really loved was the bathroom that was also large and comfortable with both a shower and bath. Would definitely revist this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel in downtown seattle”
Reviews.Author: redheadedangel41
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is a classy hotel from top to bottom. Check inn and bell service were outstanding withthe bellman giving me a complete tour of the room and amenities and filling the ice bucket. We were on the 22nd floor in a standard king room with a city skyline view. Our room was very spacious. The marble entry was was beautiful with indirect lighting (a piece of granite illuminated from behind which was beautiful) There was also a mirro and small shelf which just cried out for fresh flowers (Pike's Market $3.00 a bouquet). The bathroom was gourgeous with a very deep soaking tub featuring a waterfall faucet and glass enclosed shower. Tolitiries were of a very good quality and housekeeping staff was very generous with them. The fitness facility is state of the art with a dry sauna and steamroom (coed) Locker rooms were somewhat sparse but adequate. We did not eat at the hotel, Ruths Chris is the restaurant and they are known for their outstanding steaks. I have eaten at several location of this chain and can vouch for the quality but there are ALOT of other outstanding steak houses in Seattle After staying a week at a time at 3 different Seattle hotels we will stay here again it was also the least expensive of the three hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: StewParis
Reviews.Content: I've stayed to the Grand Hyatt for 2 days. It's a very nice property close from everything. The room are nice well decorated and have a good size and the best are the bathrooms really hudge separate bath and shower and you can play with the light to have it less bright so you can make a kind atmosphere and relax in your bath. Staff is nice nothing special. Breakfast is god also you can chose on a card but no buffet ! We will be back in this hotel for shure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: momon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about a month before arriving and I booked based on Tripadvisor reviews. I originally had booked a corner room as they had a special online. We arrived at the hotel around 1pm and check in was a breeze. To my surprise, we were upgraded to an executive suite free of charge. Nice gesture on the hotels part. The room was immaculate and large. There was actually a bar in the living room area should you want to entertain guests. The bathrooms and ameneties were perfect and so was the very comfortable bed. The location is central to everything and you can pretty much walk anywhere. My only issue was the fact that they charge you $10 per day for an internet connection. While $10 is not the end of the world, most hotels offer this for free and there is no reason a hotel of this calibre should not do this too. Other than that, this place is great and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gotthetravelbug81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt prior to leaving for our cruise to Alaska. The hotel has a modern feel and is beautiful. Our room was very nice, but on the small side. The bathroom was huge (almost bigger than the actual room). I absolutely loved it! Our bed was extremely comfortable too. The Hyatt is in a great location and is in walking distance to Pike's Market. We walked to the Space Needle, but there is a tram if you don't feel like walking far. A cab ride from the airport will run about $30. We took a limo for $40. We ate at Ruth's Chris located at the Hyatt. It was very good as usual. I was most impressed with the front desk and concierge service. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. We asked for a cab and only waited about 30 seconds. I would stay at this hotel again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: marla5575
Reviews.Content: I don't know what happened to the poor couple who stayed here around the same time my husband and I did, but we had a great experience. We found all of the front desk and bell staff to be extremely helpful and friendly, looking up concerts that were in town and acquiring sold-out Seahawks tickets for us. We did have a separate tub and shower and enjoyed the deep tub and water pressure in the shower. The toiletries are nice lavender-citrus scented, but for sensitive skin I don't recommend using the body lotion - it made my eczema flare up. The location is awesome - 10 minute walk to Pike Place, upscale shopping all around, plus an Old Navy a block away. 15 minutes down 2nd are great bars and restaurants and the Convention Center is a block away. Parking is $26 a day and it's valet, but that is to be expected in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: nonamesforme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seattle Grand Hyatt over Labor Day weekend, adult children. We were all very happy with the Hyatt. Check in was easy, the rooms are well appointed, the bathrooms are very nice (although only one sink), the breakfast, provided at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse off the lobby was good, and the concierge was genuinely helpful. The exercise room is decent in size. The adult children liked the steamroom and sauna. The parking is pretty expensive--valet at $39/night. I would recommend the Hyatt and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surely, not the #1 in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BruceT
Reviews.Content: Had reservations at Westin but changed after reading reviews & seeing the pictures of the bath area. Should have kept my reservations at the Westin or probably should have booked at the Marriott. We took the shuttle which we learned about via of the Hyatt website. We were put out at the 6th Street entrance. There was no one there at that entrance to help with baggage. We had 4 suitcases & first had to lug up stairs to the lobby. Once in the lobby, which was not impressive, we were not greeted by anyone. We lugged our bags to a cart that was at the check in deck. No problem with the check in. When the lady asked if we needed help with our luggage, we said that we had lugged it this far & had put it on the cart & thus we could get it to the room. She replied by saying that we could not use the cart & that the bell boy would have to push it. We were up high & had a good view of the Sound & the Lake but the AT&T building was in the way. When I looked in our bathroom, I noticed that it did not have a separte shower. I called the front desk to ask what happened. I told her that my main reason for changing was due to the bath area reviews. At first she did not know what I was talking about & then she said that they did have a couple of rooms that did not have a separate shower. I asked for another room & she said that they were booked up unless I wanted to upgrade. I told her no & that we would just keep the room. We proceeded to unpack. Shortly later, some lady knocked at the door & inquired as to our check in. I told her what had happened & she said that she would see what she could do. Just before we left our room, she called back to see if we wanted to move & we said no because we had already unpacked. Probably should have based on future problems. Went downstairs to the concierge, Eric. He was on the phone, not business purpose. He apparently did not appreciate us bothering him & thus he was very short with us & was no help. In fact, one of the waiters in the bar was more helpful. The bath area was very, very disappointing. The first night, we could not get but luke warm water. Only one time during our stay, did we even have to turn the cold water on. The tub was nice & big but it had some space at the back & front. This was a problem for the shower. The shower curtain did not cover the whole tub & thus water would run out on the floor. The only way for the shower not to make a mess was to take it off the holder & hold it close to the tub. Have you ever had to take a shower that the water went from would go back & forth from kind of hot to luke warm & the pressure would go back & forth? If not, stay at the Hyatt. If this is the #1 rated hotel in Seattle, then I hate to see the others. Maybe, trip advisor needs to revisit as to how they rate the hotels. We left Seattle & went to Vancouver for a couple of nights & then drove back to Seattle to fly back home. The night before we left, we stayed at the Marriotti at the airport & it was great. If it were downtown, it would put the Hyatt to shame. The best thing about the location was it was on the same block that I had a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jamesyo
Reviews.Content: a little pricey, but very good. clean, hotel staff not necessarily the most overly-friendly, but competent. had a prob w/ the in-room internet - tmobile signal was weak and the hard-line service was not working. finally a very nice engineer got it working...just peaved because it took some time to resolve when we wanted to be out and about. another note: if you have a cingular data card, the sig is weak on the 12th floor. just heard from a friend that the fairmont was cheaper and equally nice. that said, hyatt is def recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: brikrist
Reviews.Content: Booked a saturday night stay via Hotwire. Fast service, very friendly staff. Quickly got us a vase for flowers. Seamless check-in/check-out and valet. Great workout room open 24/7. Very walkable to everything downtown - great location. Fantastic experience. I stayed at the W a week later - Hyatt was nicer, more well-staffed and friendly, and a better room for the Hotwire price as well. Would recommend this highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingHobo
Reviews.Content: This may have been the first hotel that I've stayed at where I really can't find one thing that went wrong in regards to the hotel during our whole stay. The rooms were spotless, the beds very comfortable, the bathrooms huge with every amenity that you'd need, and the staff was friendly. I was even impressed with the check-in procedure, which as you know, can often be a pain even at the nicest hotels. We were literally checked in about 30 seconds. In the rooms, we liked the automatic window shade that blocks out all light and threatens to make you sleep until 1pm without even knowing. The bathroom is definitely the highlight of the room though. So if you're a bathroom snob (as so many tripadvisor writers tend to be) you won't be disappointed. The location of the hotel was very good, 7 blocks from the Pike Place market (and the waterfront area) and within easy walking distance of lots of good restaurants, bars, and shopping areas. For a good happy hour (even on weekends) go to the Dragonfish restaurant across the street at the Paramount Hotel (good Asian food & drink specials). And to top it off, the Hyatt's in-house restaurant is Ruth's Chris. If you've been there, you know how good it is. If you haven't, go and find out (if you have a few extra bucks to spend of course). Their steaks really can't be beat. This hotel definitely isn't for a budget-geared trip, but the prices aren't outrageous and we thought it was great value. So if you have the means, I highly recommend it. Enjoy Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Just married!”
Reviews.Author: dogboy87
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here while my fiancee/wife and I had our wedding (also at the Hyatt) so our experience may be different than the casual vacation-goer. With that caveat, I have only one word to describe our experience: amazing! The level of service is far superior to any I had ever received. The staff is warm and they really do anticipate your needs. We had one small problem with the shower drain and they had a service person to fix the problem within minutes. The rooms are beautiful and very well appointed. The only very small critique would be the televisions. It seems strange that in such a luxury hotel, they would supply their suites with small, standard-def televisions. Of course, the Hyatt isn't so much a business hotel as it is a vacation hotel so I imagine people have better things to do then sit around watching tv. If anyone reading this is considering the Hyatt for their wedding, I can't recommend the Hyatt enough. There's just no alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: tiffburt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was immaculate. Stunning lobby and front desk area. We had a corner suite with views of the city and Puget Sound. We could see the hydroplanes landing on the water and all the sailboats from our bed. I loved the automated shade...the switch was right next to the bed making it easy to hide or enjoy the view whenever we wanted. The room was nicely equipped with floor to ceiling windows and the beds were incredibly comfortable. We spent an entire day in bed. :) The staff was very courteous and professional. The concierge helped us find a trip fit for me (I'm pregnant) and the room service and guest services people were also fantastic. The hotel is in the perfect location, very nice neighborhood and not far from all the sites. We walked to Pike's Market and Space Needle. I highly, highly recommend this hotel. I couldn't find a single thing wrong with it. It definitely exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: transatlanticfoodie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in the middle of the downtown shopping district. Lovely common areas, spacious rooms with large windows. Warm and friendly staff. All of our needs were met. The Grand Hyatt exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Showing some wear but Grand views!”
Reviews.Author: TheQualityTime
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY: Large hotel hosting conventions and business meetings. Great views and polite service. Slightly worn around the edges and in need of a few upgrades (flat screen TVs in room). Amazing work out facilities. The place to go on business but too big for special occasions requiring a "personal touch." Just spent my 30th birthday in my hometown, Seattle, but decided to make it special with a stay in the Grand Hyatt. I checked in around 4 pm and was immediately greeted by a bellhop asking if he could check my bag. Not sure why he was asking the question, I replied, "no thanks, I'm checking in." Not a good start. After checking in, I went up to my room. We had booked an Emerald Suite (832 square feet, floors 26 - 30) and requested a quiet suite on a high floor and on a corner. I walked into the room on the 28th floor, closed the door and was about to settle into a chair and enjoy the views when I heard the thud of an ice maker, foot traffic, and a lot of thoat clearing. Stepping outside I found the ice machine across from the room and a "hospitality suite" hosting a Veterans Association. I went downstairs and Lara was able to move me up a floor...wonderfully quiet! The room itself (2922) is on a corner and offers spectacular views of Seattle: Queen Anne, EMP, Space Needle, core downtown, Pike Place, and the water! The furnishing were tasteful and the bed fairly comfortable (not as nice as a Westin "Heavenly Bed" but still wonderful). The bathroom was spectacular with a soaking tub, "waterfall" faucet, and seperate shower. The only distraction to the room was the visible wear and tear such as the dinged up and scratched furniture and the scuffs and dents in the walls. Additionally, the small old fashioned TVs seemed out of place though I have heard they will soon upgrade to flatscreens. The gym is incredible with a set of LifeFitness weight equipment that rivals most full sized gyms. Additionally, they have many pieces of Life Fitness cardio equipment such as bikes, treadmills, and ellipticals....all with personal TVs. While I found the hotel a little too impersonal for a special stay, I will not hestitate to recommend to my colleagues, clients, and vendors looking for hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: boutiques
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt on August 7-9, and enjoyed our time immensely. We stayed in room 2722, an Emerald Suite, and were given complimentary access to the Regency Club on the same floor. Here's the good: - Very peaceful and quiet - not the place to go for a party. - Excellent location - just at the E. edge of the central shopping district, probably six blocks (a nice walk) from the Public Market. Plenty of great restaurants (try ICONS - outstanding comfort food). - Excellent view (NW corner of the hotel) - directly down Pike Street past the shopping district to the Public Market, and Elliot Bay beyond. Also great view to the N. of the Space Needle. - Large room - size was perfect and comfortable. - Blackout shades - if you want to sleep in and not be awakened by the light, you'll have no problem here. - Helpful, courteous staff - we found everyone to be helpful and attentive, especially in the Regency Club. - Tastefully decorated - very warm, sumptuous appointments throughout. Great sheets and pillows. Great lighting. Great bathtub and shower. NW theme with understated asian influence. - Regency Club - tasty breakfast (if you enjoy granola and fresh fruit, and pastries), yummy snacks, plenty of papers and interesting books, great place to relax. There's complimentary internet access here also. Here's the "could have been better" (I'm reaching here, as we loved it and will definitely come back again!): - Hot water was lukewarm the first evening - no problem throughout the rest of our stay. - Drop off area is tight. Had to wait probably 10 minutes for a cab when we departed. If looking for a quiet, centrally located hotel for a getaway with your spouse, this is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Karen_To
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights in July 2007. We are a married couple travelling with our 7 month old son. We had a room on the 25th floor with a fantastic view over the water. The rooms are what you expect from a Hyatt - high end fixtures and decor. The bathrooms are massive with a separate frameless shower and extra deep soaker tup with a waterfall fawcet. The linens and bed a very comfortable and the floor to ceiling window had an electronic blackout shade which could be controlled from the bed. Seriously - it was top notch. Our only complaint, which isn't really even very fair is that we had recently stayed at the Fairmont Banff Springs and it is very hard to beat Fairmont in terms of service and Hyatt just isn't quite there. There are just little things - like the person you call to request your car be brought up - she was very gruff. But really, this is hardly that important. Also, there are no automatic doors - this is a pain for people with a stroller, but would also be a headache for people requiring wheeled assistance. Highly recommended. The location is fantastic - right across the street from the Pacific Place mall and it is on the major shopping street in town. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: GJY
Reviews.Content: It's now the only place I'll stay in Seattle. After 3 stays / 15 nights, I haven't had one problem. The staff has been frendly and efficient. The rooms, with the blackout curtains, huge bath, and comfortable beds, have been excellent. Because the bath is so spacious, the actual room with the bed could be a little tight for two, but great for solo travellers.

Reviews.Title: “My Seattle Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: bbgak
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business trip and of course as much fun as can be packed in between meetings. Seattle is a great city and this is the best hotel to stay. Service is impeccable, the room was terrific with a marble bath and shower. The view was incredible of the Pacific and the city from a high floor. I also love the Hyatt bedding and the ipod clock radios. This is a terrific hotel in a great location with a staff who aims to please from the front desk to the bellman. I have stayed at this hotel for 3 days now and before for a week and it does not tire. The location is close to sites, shopping and restuarants. Hands down, one of the best hotels, hotel rooms that I have stayed in. I will continue to stay here if I have to travel to Seattle. One suggestion though - how about wireless internet access throughout the hotel, even in the meeting rooms if you are paying for access in your room?

Reviews.Title: “Reservation non-refundable”
Reviews.Author: jmcdon7230
Reviews.Content: We had airline connection problems and didn't get to Seattle until the day after our reservation which was for Saturday. We missed the cruise ship. When we called on Saturday afternoon (from San Jose where we were stranded in the airport) and wanted to rebook for Sunday night, the hotel refused to refund the cost of Saturday night. Wouldn't discuss the situation. No refunds was "their policy" and that was that.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: tybee4
Reviews.Content: Convenient to everything - easy walk everywhere, yet right on edge of quiet area. Weekend staff seemed more attentive than weekday, however, this place knows excellent service & wonderful attitude like nowhere else! The quick-print boarding pass setup in lobby was great to discover. Had upgraded corner king suite on 23rd floor w/marvelous view. All the positives written here helped us pick this hotel, so won't repeat those. Did notice the following: our walls were paper thin & could hear neighbors; marble foyer/hall floors seemed to increase noise; "patio cushion" style love seat & chair in living area were out of character & not too comfortable; blackout shades in corner suite bedroom did not go all the way to the floor & early (4:45 a.m.) sunrise flooded the room w/light. It's worth it to upgrade to Regency club access. They had the freshest fruits & best cheeses!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt - Go for the Suite”
Reviews.Author: kecoco
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Seattle Greats: Reserve an Emerald Suite. It is the size of a one bedroom apartment with a subdued decor - sort of Arts and Craft with an Asian influence. It may sound weird but it works. The suite had spectacular views of Puget Sound and the surrounding area. Hotel services were excellent. Any request was fulfilled promptly from room service to housekeeping - they were amazingly quick. The not so greats: The lobby is cavernous with not a lot of warmth. Upon entering the hotel there is an enormous hallway directly in front of you that serves as access to their meeting and banquet rooms - very odd. The hotel does not have a bar or restaurant. Yes, there is a Ruth Chris steakhouse but Ruth Chris' for breakfast or just a place to sit in the afternoon for a drink does not suffice. But, if accomodations are what is most important to you in a hotel this one will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt was Grand”
Reviews.Author: Andreabar
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in July at the Grand Hyatt Seattle. The hotel was beautiful. The bathroom was magnificent. Had two rooms with 2 double beds in each. The hotel is within walking distance to many stores and restaurants (Cheese Cake Factory 1 block away). It is close enough to walk to Pike's Market and to the monorail to take you to the Space Needle. Don't eat breakfast at Ruth's Chris that is in the hotel. It is too expensive. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. Will definitely stay here again if I return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Ann06
Reviews.Content: After a rocky start, our visit was without incident. We arrived at the hotel much later than expected (and called from baggage claim to alert them to that fact). It was 1:30 AM local time - 4:30 AM for us - needless to say, we were exhausted. Front desk pleasantly confirmed we had booked a king, non-smoking room and proceded to send us up to a smoking room on the 23rd floor. The odor was overwhelming. Return to the front desk revealed there were only 4 unoccupied rooms in the hotel (it was a Saturday night). They offered to put us in a non-smoking double room and change us Sunday morning. No problem! That offer should have been made before the hassle of going to the smoking room...but problem solved. As promised, the front desk called at 10 AM Sunday morning with a room change available. New room, on the 17th floor, was just fine. The hotel is very conveniently located downtown - you can walk to most sites of interest. There is a Starbucks that opens to the street but is literally in the hotel. For more discerning coffee drinkers, there is a top rated local coffee shop across the street from the hotel. Other details that made our stay (June 30 - July 6, 2007) most pleasant: spacious bathroom w/dimmer switch for those night trips - separate bathtub and large shower with great shower head and very good water pressure. Bathroom is dark - they have a magnifying mirror, but it's not lit. Difficult for make-up application. Small corner of the room window opens so there's ample fresh air in the room. Blackout shades lower on an electric switch (really handy). Bed - very comfortable - no disgusting bedspread. The workout facility is well equipped with free weights and lots of cardio machines, each with its own TV monitor. Headphones provided if you don't supply your own. As mentioned in another review, refrigerated towels on offer, with cold water w/cups provided. The boarding pass printer in the lobby - super convenient. Valet parking is expensive - $31/night - however, the valet staff are very pleasant and very efficient. The entire staff - superior.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and view at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: FrisbieCat
Reviews.Content: I hesitated a bit giving this hotel an "Excellent" rating, since I have a difficult check-in experience, but on balance I really enjoyed the hotel and would highly recommend it. First, the good: The hotel is in a great location, near all the shopping action of downtown and within walking distance of all major attractions. We stayed at the hotel a full week and never once needed or wished for a car. Most importantly, our room was spectacular. I can be a tough hotel critic but there's simply no way one could complain about this room: high-end finishes, a beautiful foyer area, large sitting area, two tvs, automatic shades, plush king bed, etc. etc. The views were glorious: We had a sweeping view of downtown and the bay to the south, and an unobstructed view of the Space Needle to the west. I should mention that we booked a so-called Emerald Suite and stayed on the 27th floor. For those who can splurge a little, I would highly recommend this; the room size and views on the higher floors are worth the price. We paid $470 a night, which is a lot, but I kept thinking a comparable room with comparable views in NYC would probably cost nearly a thousand.
