I suspect the lower floors don't have quite the views but enjoy the same impressive finishes, furnishings, and bedding. Now the bad: Our check-in process was so inefficient it was actually comical. We arrived after a cruise at 9:30am, which was understandably way too early. The desk staff said to come back for our room around noon, so we headed out , took our time to be respectful, and returned around 2:30pm. Still no room, but we were told the cleaning service was in the room and it would be ready shortly; the staff asked for our cell phone number and said they would call soon. We went out for lunch, and over an hour later still no room, and no phone call. We stopped back again, and were told "ten more minutes". So, we waited within view of the front desk, and 25 minutes later no one had approached us and the staff member who had been dealing with us was now gone. Anyway, in the grand scheme of things it was not the end of the world, and based on other postings on TripAdvisor this was clearly an abberation. So, we're staying with the "Excellent" rating, but will be curious to see if future reviewers have similar experiences. Overall, notwithstanding the odd check-in experience, for location, room quality, and views, this hotel simply can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingdave19
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Memorial Day weekend with my fiance to stay at the Grand Hyatt Seattle. The hotel is very modern & the inside is very impressive. Our room was very well appointed & we had a beautiful view of the Lake surrounding Downtown. The bathroom was especially nice w/ a roomy shower & marble counter tops. The beds are also very comfy. The hotel is centrally located about a block from the main shopping mall, Macy's & Norstroms. Also about 6 blocks from Pike's Marketplace. I really enjoyed the gym as well as the sauna and jacuzzi. The gym had fantastic cardio machines with TV's in each. Also there was a fridge with cold towels & fresh water available. Definitely one of the nicest gyms I have used in a hotel. The hotel seems like it is meant primarily for business travelers. You get that feeling from the moment you arrive. That being said, I think most hotels in Downtown Seattle are like that. All in all a really nice stay at a top notch hotel. I would give it 4.5 stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Gremio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Hyatt Seattle on Pine Street. Once more we were stunned by the Hyatt quality and comfort. The hotel was excellent, the room was spacious, comfortable and well decorated. Location was great as well, it was walking distance from the famous Pike Place Market and many other attractions. No doubt it was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Greekchick
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous. Walk to everything . Great gym at the property. Ruth Chris is attached and has two Happy Hours each day. Check it out! My one complaint was that housekeeping really did not do a good job. I kept asking for extra towels, turndown service, shampoo, coffee........ They just could not get it right. Asked for hangers, took three calls to get hangers. Other than that, the place was wonderful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's truly GRAND!”
Reviews.Author: wvchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seattle for six wonderful nights at the end of June. This is one of the BEST hotels I've ever enjoyed! We upgraded to a Regency Club room and were given a corner room on the 20th floor. Great view! We loved the layout. As you enter the room, there's a small living area with a couch/chair/desk/TV. Turn down a small hallway to reach the bathroom and bed. Oh the bed! It was so comfortable! What a great way to end the busy day...just sinking into it and surrounding yourself with the many pillows. Speaking of beds...we requested a rollway for my young daughter. It was already in the room waiting for us. That's a first! I always have to call for it wherever we stay. The Regency Club is worth the extra money. They serve a nice continental breakfast complete with fresh fruit, juices and cereals. In the evening, there's always a cheese selection, veggies and a hot appetizer. For a small charge ($4 I think), you can enjoy good Washington state wines and beers. Plus, free Internet access. We saved so much money by paying a little extra per night. Holly, the Regency Club conceige, heard that we were celebrating our daughter's third birthday during our visit. Holly wrote a special Birthday note along with a special cookie with a candle and presents (rubber duck and a beach ball). It was a true act of kindness on her part. Everyone from the valets and the front desk folks to the Regency Club staff is very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was top notch. Each day the room was spotless. Each night our beds were turned down and ice brought to the room. We were treated like royality. There's no place else to stay while in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Distinctive Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andaltex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four days at the Grand Hyatt during business related travel. I agree with previous posts regarding the excellence of this hotel. At arrival, we were given the opportunity for a room upgrade and took advantage of getting a large corner suite with a view of downtown and Elliott Bay. The room was quiet, and had a spacious, super clean bathroom, terrific closet space, and a large work area. The decor was quite distinctive - sort of Pacific Rim meets Frank Lloyd Wright! From the moment we arrived, the staff was excellent - extraordinarily friendly and helpful, from the concierge to the bellstaff to housekeeping. The location was perfect, right near the convention center and major shopping. Anything in downtown Seattle is within 10-15 minutes walking distance. When I return, I'm not sure I'd want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Rooms, Not So Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: WaterfallsLover
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here during her husbands week-long conference at the Westin and am kind of on the fence about how I feel about the Grand Hyatt. The rooms are fabulous. I want this bathroom in my house! The housekeeper was terrific and the beds are super comfy with down comforters. Also, the hotel is close to everything! We ran into a couple snags - otherwise I would have rated this hotel a 5. First, the concierge's at this hotel were not helpful at all. Maybe we would have been treated differently if we walked up to the desk in business suits. Scott, the night time concierge told us that all of their pamphlets were moved around but he would provide us with information on Victoria, we gave him our room number and nothing. Not even a telephone call. There was one woman that was helpful and we wish that she was there during the other times we needed help. We actually received better assistance at the Westin and we weren't even staying there! Second, upon leaving I tried to use the elevators only to find out that there was some kind of fire alarms going off. I thought this was odd since the fire alarm lights near the elevators were not flashing. I called down to the front desk and was told that the fire department needed to turn off the alarms and should take place by 6:00 a.m.. When I tried to go down again around 6:05, the elevators still would not work. I told her that I needed to leave in order to catch my flight and asked her to send up someone to bring down my luggage. She said OK but after 5 minutes, I had a strange feeling that I wasn't going to get any help. So, I lugged my suitcase down 10 flights. I guess I was kind of lucky, some guests had to come down as far as 26 flights of stairs. When I got to the last set of stairs, someone from Hyatt asked if I needed help. Yeah, OK. It's a little late for that! Later, I was told that the bellboys didn't even start their shift until 8:00 a.m.. I would have waited an aweful long time by the elevators if I hadn't decided to walk down the stairs! Bottom line. The hotel rooms are top notch but if you need help getting around the city, you better ask for help from someone other than the concierge's at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comparison: Grand Hyatt & Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Riverspots
Reviews.Content: We moved from the Sheraton (conference location) to the Grand Hyatt for a few more days in Seattle so here is a bit of information about each of them. They are both very comfortable and convenient. Our room at the Sheraton was big and bright but the bathroom was pretty small and a little dated. The Grand Hyatt room was much smaller and very dark but the bath was gorgeous. It was huge and new but the light was so dim it was really difficult to apply makeup. The amenities at the Sheraton are worthless - the Grand Hyatt was much better (but not as nice as Sofitel). Bed at the Sheraton was very comfortable but the Hyatt was incredible. Plus, they had a neat electronic room-darkening shade that really helped in the morning. They also had an electronic privacy button rather than the little tag you put outside the door. It was very quiet at both locations. They both charge $10 for in-room Internet, which I think is nickel & dime stuff considering the price of the room. The Hyatt (I think - and maybe the Sheraton, too) also tacks on a charge for the morning newspaper. You can choose not to get it, but you have to do so at registration, I believe. The only bar at the Hyatt is the Ruth Chris' bar - when we tried to take a glass of wine upstairs to our room, we were told that was not usually allowed, but if we were discreet, it was okay. We were successful, but I didn't appreciate feeling like a crook to take my drink upstairs! Did not attempt this at the Sheraton bar, so can't say about that. Overall, both hotels were very good experiences and I can recommend either. I'd say, go with the best price, unless a real modern look is important to you. Then go with the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pugmix
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I only stayed at the Hyatt for one night, before we left on a cruise to Alaska. I loved the hotel! I wish we could have stayed longer. I thought our room was very comfortable and modern. The bathroom was very nice with a large tub and separate shower. We found the staff very polite and accomodating. Everyone was friendly and went out of their way to help us with directions and questions. We ate breakfast at Ruth's Chris, the restaurant in the hotel and we both thought the food was good (the french toast was delicious!) The only obstacle we ran into, was the entrance to the hotel. We had several bags of luggage with us and wished the front and side doors had automatic/sliding doors. Overall, we had a good experience at the Hyatt. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Fun”
Reviews.Author: roomandbored
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Grand Hyatt over Labor Day Weekend. Originally booked on the 29th floor in a beautiful room. As stated in other reviews, the bathroom is almost as big as the bedroom... which is really great. Spent a lot of time in the tub! On the second day of our stay, the room next to us started sounding like a night club... around 4pm! After a quick peek, we realized it was a group of kids for Prom. Rather than deal with them later in the night we called downstairs and were moved immediately to the 26th floor. The room was slightly smaller, but definitely quiet! The staff was VERY helpful in our transition to rooms and the entire ordeal was over within a matter of minutes. The Grand Hyatt is very conveniently located to shopping, restaurants and the waterfront. We rented a car from Enterprise, which is only 4 or 5 blocks from the hotel. Seattle was wonderful and so is this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels EVER”
Reviews.Author: rugbyshirt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seattle while attending a conference and could not have been more pleased. It was one of the best hotel stays I have ever had. The room was absolutely gorgeous ... I honestly don't think I've ever seen a more attractive hotel room. It was like something out of Architectural Digest. Beautiful furniture, wall coverings, window treatments, everything. I loved the automatic blackout blinds over the gigantic windows (I could see the top of the Space Needle from mine) -- you can raise or lower the shade without getting out of the very comfy bed. Lots of nice little touches; I liked having a little "do not disturb" light you can turn on rather than hanging a sign on the doorknob -- very convenient and classy. The bathroom was ENORMOUS, and stunning. Marble, brass, huge glass shower, beautiful fixtures. The tub was so large and inviting that I couldn't resist taking a bath, and I'm not even a bath person. The location was wonderful -- about a block from the convention center, and tons of dining and shopping options within easy walking distance. Loved the Barnes & Noble across the street and the Starbucks you can get to directly off the hotel lobby. The desk staff was friendly, professional, and helpful; I never had to wait in line to be helped. The lobby has lots of comfy seating and is a great place to meet friends and chat. This feels like a boutique hotel -- you never feel like you're in some huge monolith. The hotel is actually quite compact, so you're never too far from the elevator (though I never heard it, or much of anything else, from my very quiet room). I can't recommend this hotel enough, and hope I'll get to return to Seattle soon just so I can stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay...”
Reviews.Author: fez030303
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay at the Grand Hyatt for 2 nights, but when we arrived they were notifying guests that they had overbooked the hotel that night due to an ongoing convention. So they offered to pay for us to stay at the Fairmont Olympic (about 4 blocks away) for one night. They would even pay for our cab fare to the Fairmont and back. Although the Fairmont was beautiful and regal, the Grand Hyatt was far more impressive (to us). Upon check-in our one night there, the front desk was so apologetic about the inconvenience that they gave us a corner suite. It was gorgeous. The hotel is contemporary, but has almost a mission-shaker influence to it (see pics). All the guest rooms had door bells and "do not disturb" buttons instead of door knob hangers. Our room also had electronic retractable drapery shades. Very cool! The hotel management left a letter of apology in our room, as well as a large bowl of fruit with a small bottle of wine. That was a nice surprise! We will definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt our next time in Seattle!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Contemporary Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: september2374
Reviews.Content: We scheduled a long weekend to explore downtown Seattle. Searching from sidestep.com, we found a flight+hotel package. Fair from the airport was about $25. When we arrived at our room, we were floored. We've stayed at many nice hotels, but this recently re-done room was clean, modern and comfortable. If you need a giant room, this place isn't for you. The bedroom, bathroom and living room were all the same size...which we loved. It made for a huge, luxurious bathroom. We've learned to tell everyplace we stay that we're celebrating our anniversary...we make it a point...making sure to call back to assure special touches have been added (usually for free)...we arrived to find free champagne & cookies. They put us in a corner suite on the 24th floor and the view was stunning! Ruth's Chris Steakhouse is attached downstairs (watch those bar tabs!!!) We tried to locate the hot-tub afterhours but it's within their own spa...which was closed. The gym was available, however, and the equipment was new, modern and the area was quite empressive. This hotel is within walking distance of every downtown attraction. The monorail will take you to the space needle. Argosy Dinner Cruises are HIGHLY recommended by me (again, you're celebrating your anniversary for special treatment). You will want to take a cab down to the Cruise Piers. Everything else is within a 15 minute walk from this hotel...even if you're drunk.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night Bliss”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyg54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for our wedding night on April 7, 2007. We booked a corner suite and were offered an upgrade when my fiance went to check in to the hotel. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to wait for the updated room since he checked in before our ceremony so we stuck with our original room. I have to say that we were not disappointed. The staff left us chocolate covered strawberries and a note congratulating us on our wedding when we finally got to the room after 1am. We loved the view, the bed, the living room area and the gorgeous bathroom. We ordered room service on Easter Sunday and really enjoyed our breakfast sandwiches. It was a little pricey but totally worth it to not have to leave our gorgeous room. I joked with my husband that now he'll have to take me there every year for our anniversary-we loved it and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Really good ... but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Spacrawler
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Grand Hyatt Seattle for a conference. I paid $300 for a Regency Club room, actually a Corner Suite. I'm not sure if all Regency Club guests get these rooms or what. The hotel is conveniently located, although all of downtown Seattle seems to be under construction, and the street in front of the hotel is totally dug up. This means noise. The interior of the hotel is teaky wood, modern and uncluttered. I found the staff to be young and a little inexperienced, but generally fine. There were two things I wish could be better about the property. First, my corner suite was cramped, dark and stuffy. There is only one little tiny window that opens, and with the construction noise, I didn't open it. There is a funky cooling system in place, such that you can only turn the temp down so far, then you can not set it to run and cool constantly. Often it was on auto and thus the stuffiness. The lighting in the room was poor, except for the bathroom, which had great lighting. The carpet was worn and stained in places. A couple of other points - you will pay for internet access; you will be charged if you move anything in the minibar (you can get a fridge for $5 a day), and you will be disappointed with the old fashioned TVs, if you like to watch the tube. On the plus side, the bed, the linens, and the bath with separate tub and shower were fantastic. The other issue I had was with dining options - or the lack thereof. There is a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse in the hotel, but their menu is pretty limited (especially for breakfast) and very pricey. I wish they had a restaurant that was less clubby with more choices. if you don't eat meat, you will not have much to choose from. I guess I would stay at this hotel again, but not for the price I paid. I researched my options very carefully, and I beieve that I got the best of what was available. Others at the conference stayed at the Sheraton, which is under a major renovation, and the Westin. Neither excited my colleagues. Perhaps Seattle is ripe for a true luxury hotel - wonder why the Four Seasons abandoned ship and the famous Olympic Hotel is now being run by Fairmont?

Reviews.Title: “Some Additional Details....”
Reviews.Author: tonymoco
Reviews.Content: The other positive reviews have already said it all, and I agree with them. In particular, the rooms are among the most beautiful and functional of any hotel I have stayed in. I just want to fill in a few details that might help others.... What you want is a water view on a high floor with upgrade to Regency Club (27th floor) if available. Regency Club includes cont b'fast, evening appetizers, coffee/water almost 24/7, free internet access, nice space to hang out in. The Concierge can arrange very good Limo to/from SeaTac for around $50 each way. Hertz Local Addition Car Rental is RIGHT around the corner and shares a garage with the Grand Hyatt. Very convenient and open weekends. Check Hertz website for HLE (Hertz Local Addition) deals. At least two different city tours pick up at hotel. Concierge can arrange. Also Starbucks in Hotel Lobby. 10-15 minute walk to Public Market. 20 -30 minute walk to WA State Ferries Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evvtraveler
Reviews.Content: When visiting Seattle and you want to stay downtown, check out the Grand Hyatt Seattle. From it's location, top notch rooms, staff and ammenties this is the place to stay. During me stay I was in an Emerald Suite on the 28th floor. Wondeful city views, huge bathroom, automatic blackout drapes and a huge bed that was like sleeping on a cloud to name a few. The food and service at the in-house restaurant, Ruth Chris Steakhouse was excellent. This hotel is a central location to shopping, dining, Seattle's best sites and the monorail to Seattle Center. If your plans include visiting Seattle, check out the Grand Hyatt. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “How definitely GRAND it is!!!”
Reviews.Author: D-fine
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to Seattle, do yourself a favor and stay here! Excellent staff, gorgeous rooms, and SUPERB location! Ruth's Chris steakhouse is on site and is worth EVERY penny. Had a wonderful 4 night stay! The bathrooms are truly unbelievable and room service was top notch as well. Highly recommend for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “All-round fabulous experience!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvgreathotels
Reviews.Content: This hotels deserves its accolades and five-star ratings in all categories. From its perfect location to its top-notch staff and beautiful rooms and amenities, this is one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Our room rate included the Regency Club breakfasts and late afternoon snacks which included delicious and beautifully presented food of ample portions. All of the staff at the hotel were friendly and consistently tried to not only meet but anticipate a traveller's needs. The rooms were very spacious and clean and the bathrooms were 'to die for'!! I would recommend this hotel whole-heartedly and will stay there again should I visit Seattle in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Modern, Comfy (Elliott) Grand Hyatt Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BSA126
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Seattle is a modern hotel located very close to the shopping areas of Downtown Seattle. The lobby is dimly lit. Parking is expensive at the Hyatt. There is only one restaurant, Ruth Chris Steakhouse, which serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We stayed in the Business Plan two double room, room 1523. For appoxiamately 10-20 USD more, you get these extras: Free wired internet and free breakfast- coupon(this will be explained later in the review). The restroom has a beautiful, vast, modern Kohler tub, a marble shower, one cup coffee maker (the ones which make one cup of coffee using a pod for coffee), etc. The restroom has White Ginger flavored Portico toiletries (which are very expensive), and NO toothbrushes (as always with most hotels these days). Also, they have robes (one in bathroom, one in closet) in the room. The beds in the room are very soft. They give you SIX !!!! pillows on the bed. The "Grand Bed" also uses down comforters, etc). The room also has a TV, minibar, lots of storage, big safe, work desk, three chairs, power blackout blinds (they go down and are not see through unlike the other blinds in the room), and a photo of something. They also give you USA today newspapers everyday. Service is impeccable at the Grand Hyatt. They have surveys to make sure customer service is good, request forms in room (for room cleaning), and a wonderful concierge (Chuck was there when we were at the Grand Hyatt). Ruth Chris Steakhouse is delicious, but pretty expensive. We ate there for breakfast. The eggs benedict is yummy. All "main courses (middle of menu) are served with fruit and roasted fingerling potatoes and onions. They do have a problem though, with the drinks. They DO NOT post the drink prices or side dish prices. All we know when we were there was: coffee was FREE, orange juice was $3.00 USD, and toast was $2. Orange juice is included with the continental breakfast ( they will ask you which kind of juice you want). The free continental breakfast, included with the business plan rooms, are not continental breakfast. It is actually a $15 dollar pass (each guest in room gets one per day, i.e. three night stay with one guest: three breakfast passes) which you can use to buy anything in the breakfast menu. I would stay again at this hotel. It is excellent, and very new. I will post pictures later....

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: legendtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in for a one night stay for our 21st wedding anniversary. We reserved a king room with a water view. When we got to out room, it was looking at the freeway, nice room but not the view we were looking for. We went back down to the desk and told them this was a very special anniversary night and could we please have a water view. She did a little checking, apologized and said we would be very happy. We went back to our new room and it was the top floor executive suite, nicest room I think we have ever stayed in. I would definetely go back to the Hyatt Seattle. This is a beautiful hotel and the staff is very accomodating. We went to Ruth Chris for dinner and also told them it was our anniversary and they decorated our table gave us complimentary appetizers and two glasses of champagne. They were very nice also, but the dinner was too expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: meklof
Reviews.Content: Arriving at noon, the front desk staff checked us in without any problems and even gave us a water view room. The included continental breakfast at the hotel restaurant Ruth Chris Steakhouse was delicious. When the front desk staff found out ,upon check out, that we were unable to check in at their online kiosk, they quickly forwarded us to the concierge who took care of this with a smile! The room was in excellent condition, spacious bathroom with a large shower. The hotel is located next to the Pacific Mall with Pike Market only a few blocks away. This is my number 1 hotel in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Truly grand!”
Reviews.Author: Amanita
Reviews.Content: Definitely a first-class hotel! We stayed there for one night in November 2006 for a romantic getaway. The hotel is conveniently located downtown, close to shopping. The lobby area is an amazing first impression. The room was modern, clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. For some fun and decadent highlights: doorbell outside the door; a light to indicate "do not disturb"; and a switch at the bed side to open and close the window shades (!). The bathroom was huge and about the same size as the bedroom itself. The decor and setup were very grand: separate glass enclosed shower and bathtub (wide flowing faucet); beautiful sink area with stone counters. Definitely one of the most special hotels I've stayed at. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “What They Said”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: Got iced in at Seatac, the airline lost my luggage, I was stranded and every motel within ten miles of the airport were filled with similarly stuck travelers. To offset my bad mood, I called The Hyatt, got a bad and 30 minutes later was walking into my room. The desk clerk took pity on me, upgraded me to an Executive Suite on the top floor and hooked me up with all the toiletries I was missing. Spectacular hotel. Can't put it any other way. Opulent. Great location for walking. Seattle in December is beautiful. Stay here. Treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: swimnski
Reviews.Content: One of the nicer Hyatt's on the west coast. Bathrooms are absolutely amazing. Very modern bath fixtures with the largest tub I've ever seen in a Hyatt. The bed was comfy, room service excellent and the location cannot be beat. Whether you come to Seattle for vacation or business, this hotel is worth every penny. Skip your car rental, make transportation arrangements with a transfer company or taxi - you will not need a car when staying at this hotel. ). I was there in September and every day was sunny and cool. Not what I expected for 5 days in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouzaKH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt on business for 5 nights in October 2006. My family came with me for two of the days and at check-in they easily upgraded me to a corner suite for a few dollars more. Check-in was one of the smoothest and friendliest I have ever experienced. The clerk called me in my room a few minutes later to see if everything was okay. The rooms are great, the corner suites are very nice with an entrance and sitting room well separated from the bedroom by a long hallway. Why didn't I give the Grand Hyatt 5 stars? 1) The only food in the hotel is a Ruth's Chris and while they serve breakfast, it is at Ruth's Chris prices. 2) In-room housekeeping during my stay was minimal at best. Some days they didn't even replace the dirty wine glasses or drinking glasses. They would also missed dirty towels on the floor. I expected a bit more in these areas from a hotel of this class.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fromArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after our cruise. From checkin through checkout, the service was outstanding. The rooms are very attractively decorated with comfortable bedding. The bathroom is grand, and I do so appreciate a nice robe when I travel. The view from the room was spectacular. It is convenient to shops and dining. Don't think you can go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Down to Earth Staff”
Reviews.Author: MFLetou
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Seattle is a rare first class hotel that doesn't act like it. What I mean is that the hotel itself is first class; beautifully appointed in an excellent location. But unlike most properties of this level, the Grand Hyatt has a truly down to earth, friendly staff that puts guests of all stripes at ease. The hotel is located in a major commerical district, on the same block as a Cheesecake Factory and within a few blocks of major department stores and restaurants. Pike's Place is about a 10 minute walk and visible at the end of the street. You could not pick a more perfect location for Seattle. The hotel lobby is fairly intimate, but done in a very chic style. Its a hushed sort of atmosphere, with a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse on the left and a full-service Starbucks (not just a kiosk) to the right. Per my request, my room was a corner suite overlooking the harbor and the Space Needle. The view was absolutely stunning on both ends. The room itself was roomy enough, split into two parts--a sitting area and a bedroom area. The bathroom was very large, with a separate glass shower. The set up was good because it allowed you to keep the bedroom area uncluttered. The shades do indeed close electronically. The bed itself was comfortable, on the plush side. The hotel was quiet, save for some street noise even on a high floor. It was not disruptive. Interior insulation appeared to be good--we never heard our neighbors. If I have a complaint about the room decor, its only that a few pieces of furniture looked a little worn--out of place in that setting. Also, I was a bit surprised that the televisions were the old fashioned kind rather than flat screen. That's hardly a complaint, just an observation that similiar properities have upgraded. Overall, the room was stylish and inviting. I am not a fan of valet parking, and I typically feel a bit out of place dealing with hotel staff at better hotels. The Grand Hyatt was an atypical experience for me. Everyone right down to the valet staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. This is the kind of place that within a day or staying there, every staff member you encounter greets you by name. The valet car service was prompt and efficient, and nobody was trolling for tips (though in this case I didn't mind giving them, they were earned). The advice was good and unpretentious. Be advised that this hotel sometimes is the home for major sports teams. During my stay, the Boston Red Sox were there, which was a major attraction for me and my wife. That meant there were some autograph seekers and the like outside the hotel, but the hotel had security to make sure that only registered guests were inside the lobby and interacting with the players. Overall, the Grand Hyatt Seattle is an excellent hotel that I highly recommend. I would have a hard time returning to Seattle and NOT staying there, simply because the standard has been set so high that I'm certain there's nowhere else that can match it. I should add that the rate I paid was extremely reasonable given the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hyatt is just that..Grand !!”
Reviews.Author: colby_Tim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Hyatt many times, But even when we haven't been back for a year they tell us "welcome back" before we even get out of the car! They have a way of making you feel like their favorite guest. You will not find a better view or nicer rooms, I love the fact that with a flip of a switch the blinds go up to feveal the down town sky line. Also the pollow top beds are sent strait from heavan! We have stayed at almost all the fine Hotels in Seattle, but we always seem to come back to the Hyatt. I tell all my friends about the Hyatt and many of them have come down and had the same experience. I honestly can't think of one negative thing to say about our experience's at this hotel. Room service was very fast and staff very helpful. We have spent many anniversary's there, and will be coming down for our up coming 25 th. To the staff Keep up the good work !! sincerely Tim and Melanie

Reviews.Title: “We would happily recommend the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Laonie
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was our arrival point during a recent trip from Australia to Canada and Alaska. Check-in was quick, even though we were initially allocated a room with twin beds instead of the requested king plus rollaway. The error was corrected immediately and we were shown to a pleasant room with city views. The bed was comfortable and made up with very good quality white linen, which is always nice. The rollaway bed for our son arrived very quickly. The spacious marble bathroom had double basins, a huge shower & great water pressure and was stocked with products we actually enjoyed using. We found our room to be uncomfortably warm at night, but we later discovered this to be the case in more or less every hotel we stayed. We are from Queensland, so maybe we keep our air conditioning too cold at home! Our tariff included access to the Regency Club, which provides keyed entry to an attractive private lounge on the 27th floor. The lounge served breakfast each morning, complimentary all-day drinks and evening canapés. The food was well presented and the selection offered was good. All the staff were professional and courteous and any queries or requests were acted upon immediately. The Hyatt is very well located close to the main shopping precinct. It also has the usual suspects located within the premises, including of course, a Starbucks (which was handy, because we can’t stand the ‘creamer’ they supply in US hotels, so we never use the coffee machines in the rooms) The only jarring note was the rather Orwellian set-up with the mini-bar. The fridges are equipped with pressure sensors, and you are changed for a product as soon as you pick it up, regardless of whether you put it back down again or not. It might make restocking easier for the staff, but it is totally user-unfriendly for guests who simply want to chill their own bottle of water. Taxi-fare from the airport was around $40 including the tip, but the hotel also has a shuttle that stops right out front to take you to the (clean, bright, and well serviced) airport. We tried the shuttle on the way out and it worked out fine, and way cheaper than a cab. We loved Seattle. The Pike markets and the waterfront lend it its own unique personality. We felt perfectly safe, and it was very easy to find our way around. The Grand Hyatt is essentially a stock-standard member of the 5 star accommodation monoliths, and it doesn’t have a heap of personality as a result. Once inside, you could be anywhere in the world. Of course, you’re only a room number to them, but who cares – this one still ‘does what it does’ very well indeed. Variety being the spice of life we’ll give the Opus a try if we ever return, but we would happily recommend the Hyatt to anyone visiting this very attractive city.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its great reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Mandirae
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights end of Aug. and came back to stay our last night before return home. We had an executive suite on the 29th floor with a beautiful view. The service was excellent. Everyone went out of their way to please. Housekeeping was excellent. We would definetly stay here again and highly recommend it to others considering this hotel.Loved the location. Close to restaurants and shopping. Near the Pacific Place Mall and Westlake Ctr. Nice shops and restaurants. Had our breakfasts(included with the AAA special) in the Ruth Chris restaurant. Meals were excellent. Did not eat at Ruth Chris for dinner as we were visiting family and dined at other recommended restaurants, but imagined the food to be equally good. The dormen new us by name and were very friendly. Can walk to Pikes Market and City Center. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular in every sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: Mr&Mrs23
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the top 2-3 hotels that I have ever stayed in my life. I have stayed at The Ritz Carton in Washington DC, and also the Four Seasons in Hawaii, all top-notch and world class, but I have to say, this hotel is right up there with those high end places, without a doubt. And very, very reasonably priced, believe it or not. The bathrooms in the lobby are gorgeously appointed. Actually, the entire hotel from top to bottom is beautiful, with an asian flair. Lots of dark exotic woods, beautiful granite, lots of fountains and bamboo in the lobby. The bathroom in our room was fantastic; the granite shower was humungous. THe bed was one of the most comfortable and roomy, too. Everything was clean and tip top in shape. We loved our stay here, and joked at the time that we wanted to take up permanent residence right there in the hotel! We hope to return to Seattle again one day. When we do, we will undoubtedly return once again to the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: traveledall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Seattle for a vacation. I checked out just about every hotel in Seattle before I booked the Grand Hyatt. This hotel was wonderful- one of the best we've ever been to. It's in a great location--near the Convention Center, lots of shopping, restaurants, and public transportation, and only a few blocks from Pike's Market. The rooms are beautifully appointed, with a very comfortable bed, lots of pillows, a lighted closet, and a really large bathroom with separate shower and soaking tub. We used the convenient valet parking, with in and out privileges. There is an attached parking lot for self-parking without in and out. The concierge gave us great dinner recommendations and provided maps and directions to tourist locations. There is a Ruth Chris Steakhouse attached to the hotel lobby. We went there for breakfast every day. They met all our menu requests for smaller portions and charged commensurately lower prices. We left the hotel for a few days of traveling and had no problem leaving some luggage in the hotel storeroom until our return The couple of glitches we had (maid forgot the towels one day, etc.) were immediately resolved to our satisfaction. We very highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Stay in an Executive Suite”
Reviews.Author: MisterW
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle only a couple of days before boarding an Alaskan cruise. I wanted a hotel close to the major attractions and was hoping for a Space Needle view. The Grand Hyatt came very highly rated on this site and after out stay, I am happy to add my top rating as well. We booked an executive suite and requested a high floor with a view. We were given a room on the 29th floor with a perfect Space Needle view. The two room suite was very spacious and had several nice touches such as automatic drapes and a partial kitchen. Everything was in walking distance or a few minutes in a cab. I wouldn't say the hotel staff was overly friendly, but they were courteous and professional, just what you would expect in top downtown business oriented hotel The hotel also has a lot of fun dining options and what looked to be a great spa. All in all, we had a great, if brief, stay and would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you don't plan on using the water”
Reviews.Author: Heart10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Grand Hyatt around 4 pm on Thursday, May 25th. We were warmly greet and escorted to the check-in. Check-in was simple and quick. We were then escorted to our room, which was a corner suite with a decent view, if you like ugly rooftops. The gentleman who took us to our room was pleasant and very informative of the area. He showed us all the features of our room. Thirty minutes after being in the room we received a letter under the door explaining that the water to the hotel would be cut off at midnight and back on at 4 am. We did not consider this a problem as they stated they were flushing the system. At 10 pm we received another letter under the door that was a duplicate of the second letter. We woke up at 6:30 am as we were heading to LA on Amtrak that left at 10 am. We found that we did not have any water. We called downstairs and was informed that we would have water in 30 minutes. At 7:15 we still had no water but they offered to send bottled water to our room, which we declined. Ten minutes later the doorbell rang and we found 2 bottles of water sitting at the door. We were not sure what they expected us to do with 2 - 16 oz. bottles of water. At 7:30 we called the desk again about the water and was told they had water in the gym and we could take showers there. We asked if they had hot water and was told yes. Imagine our surprise when we got there and found they only had cold (ice cold) water. I then went down to the desk and was told that we would have water to our room by 8:30 that it was a long process to get the water throughout the hotel. I explained that we had to leave by then to which they did not reply. By the time I got back to my room, there was 2 more bottles of water sitting at the door. We immediately packed out belongings, we down to checkout and asked that they call a taxi for us. They told us they would get us a taxi outside to just go on out. They also offered us bottled water to take with us. Once outside we were informed they should have called for a taxi inside, so the gentleman outside was standing in the road trying to flag down a taxi instead of someone going inside to call. There was a gentleman who drives his a personal Town Car that was there waiting to pickup passengers for airport flights (no reservations required with this gentleman and he charges the same as a taxi) he volunteered to take us to the Amtrak station. We wanted to get away before they offered us more bottled water so we took him up on it. As we drove away the gentleman was still in the road trying to flag down a taxi while his co-workers watched. The wonderful gentleman with the Town Car charged us $5.00. We gave him $20.00 because we would have paid that or more for taxi. I'm sure the Grand Hyatt is a wonderful place to stay but when checking in, make sure they are not planning on turing the water off.

Reviews.Title: “Decent food service would give it 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've used this very helpful site so many times that I've decided it's only fair to begin to contribute to it. This hotel has a lot going for it. First, a great staff, the equal to the best hotels we've ever stayed in, very friendly and helpful. Second, terrific rooms, or at least our room was. We had a very nice one bedroom suite on the club level with incredible panaromic views of the sound, the peninsula and but for an unfortunately located building next door, Mt. Ranier. The clunky tv in the armoire was a bit of a surprise in this context; the room cries out for a plasma on the wall--not that we would have turned it on with the views! However, the restaurant and lounge situation keeps this hotel from the 5 star level. First, if you think Ritz Carlton when you hear club level, forget it. You pay for what you might order from the extremely limited and basic drink menu, even for a diet coke, and the hor d'oeurve service is,well, unimpressive. There is only one restaurant and lounge in the hotel, the Ruth's Chris Steakhouse located next door (with an entrance from the hotel lobby). If you want a quiet drink, it is noisy and crowded and filled with people who perhaps have been there too long. If you want breakfast, you get a limp one page xerox of your egg choices. If you want dinner, you get steak. This is just lazy and cheap, and really a shame given the staff, the location and the physical plant of this otherwise fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cades2go
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in May. My company was doing a show at the convention center, half a block away. I chose the Grand Hyatt out of all the convention hotels because I had stayed there once in 2004 and loved it. This visit was even better, because I was there for a full week. Customer service in all areas of the hotel is excellent. When I'm on a business trip, I want to know the hotel staff will help me fix anything that goes wrong. I wanted a place with meeting space, in case I needed it at the last minute. I had a corner suite on the 23rd floor, with a view of the water from one of the smaller windows. I am now certain I don't want to live in Seattle, because it rained or was darkly overcast almost the whole time, in May! Luckily we were up high enough to have lots of (gray) light. The housing prices in California are depressing, but not as depressing as Seattle weather. I love the interior design, which uses natural materials in a modern, somewhat masculine way. The bathroom has a deep tub and separate shower. The light over the tub is on a dimmer. It would be better if all the lights were dimmable. I love the lavender and citrus-scented toiletries, but I know some people can't stand the fragrance. I was disappointed that the towels are kind of rough. I didn't remember that from my previous visit. I can't seem to find soft hotel towels anywhere but at Four Seasons. I had dinner with a friend at Ruth's Chris Steak House in the hotel. Yummy! Gigantic onion rings, flavorful sirloin steak, grilled asparagus...I had no room for dessert. I also had drinks with a client in the bar at Ruth's. They close at midnight on weekdays, which surprised me. They didn't rush us out, though. There are two movie theaters within a block of the hotel. There are three shopping malls within four blocks, but they're nothing too exciting if you live in the Bay Area. The corner suite comprised a sitting area, a narrow hallway, and the bedroom. The sitting area and bedroom are not separated by a door. On one side of the hallway are two sets of double doors, for the closet. The other side has the door to the bathroom. Like the bathroom door in a standard room, it's wood with glass inserts that are translucent but not transparent. There's none of that nonsense you see in W hotels, with their see-through windows between the bedroom and bathroom. I decided against a Regency Club room, because there are lots of fabulous places to eat in Seattle (Flying Fish, Etta's, Salumi). I did use the gym a couple times. For a windowless room, it is very attractive, in the same style as the rest of the hotel. I used the elliptical, treadmill, and free weights. They also have stairsteppers and weight machines. The cardio machines have tv screens. I especially liked the small fridge with chilled, moist towels. There's a watercooler and a tiny gym lounge with magazines. Some of my colleagues couldn't understand why I'd want to stay four extra nights in Seattle after my three-day business trip, but the Hyatt's customer service and luxurious beauty made it worth the money and time. There are many things to like about this place, but the staff is their strength. The customer service here rivals that at Four Seasons, even if the towels don't.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our Christmas vacation for a night. It was fantastic, I wish we could have stayed in the hotel for our whole trip. It was so perfectly located, within walking distance to all the major attractions downtown. Our room had a fabulous view of downtown and the water, where we could see the ferries crossing Puget Sound. We loved being able to walk to Pike Place Market (about 8 blocks) for breakfast in the morning, and it's very close to the upscale shopping and movie theaters downtown. The decor was fantastic, in keeping with the Northwest -- sort of asian inspired in warm browns and creams. The bathroom was marvelous -- a huge glass-enclosed marble shower, and a separate large soaking tub. The lighting could be adjusted for comfort. The hotel was quiet and peaceful. We hardly saw any other guests. My only complaints: The bedroom area was a little small, and while the bed was comfortable, I think they used down or some other fiber in a feather bed that had sharp edges poking through the linens. That sometimes made for a few pricks when laying in bed. (It wasn't enough of a problem that I couldn't sleep though.) Also, the valet parking was very expensive as you might expect at a downtown hotel. There is a parking garage next door when you can park yourself and save substantially.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect locaion, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: niclou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Grand Hyatt and loved it. We were in Seattle for a meeting at the convention center and it was right across the street. It was the perfect location for shopping,too. Everything is right there and you are in walking distance of Pike Market Place. The hotel has a Starbucks, Ruth Chris Steakhouse and The Cheesecake Factory. Ruth Chris is also the hotel's main restauraunt and bar. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner there. The breakfast selection was terrific and of course the dinner was fabulous. We never had lunch there, but I'm sure it was good also. They have a great happy hour with half price appetizers from 4-6 and again from 9-11. The rooms were nice and the bathrooms were great. There is a coffeemaker in the room, a nice hairdryer, iron and ironing board and a safe in the closet. Everything you need right there. The staff was so nice and helpful, they really added to our wonderful week in Seattle. If we are ever back in Seattle, we will definatley stay at the Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt is excellent”
Reviews.Author: bc_sanjose
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now, including last weekend. The single best thing about this Hyatt is the bathrooms - spacious and clean with a walk-in shower as well as a tub... I wish more hotels were built to these plans. The staff is very pleasant and a water view is a big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best, for sure”
Reviews.Author: S0CalTraveler
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of business traveling and found my recent stay at the Grand Hyatt in downtown Seattle to be among the best experiences in years. The decor is modern and relatively new. My room was spacious and the bathroom had both a deep, clean tub at one end and excellent shower at the other. Wake-up calls are done by staff and you even have the option when making the reservation for more than one wake-up (which one of my sleepy colleagues certainly appreciated). The location, as already mentioned, is great because of all the shops and restaurants within a few blocks. Even getting to and from the airport was a breeze. I had to leave immediately after my conference and the concierge arranged for a cab to be there waiting for me so I could make my flight. For me, the best feature of this place is the outstanding service by the staff. I was in charge of my event and everyone on my staff found the Hyatt personnel to be helpful, cheerful and accommodating. We also all raved about the place and were mad we hadn't left more time to enjoy it. We all did take a soak in that huge tub, though. Granted, it's on the pricey end if you're a budget traveler, but I think you get your money's worth if accommodations and service are important to you. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Again”
Reviews.Author: Jilliantraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The location is literally within walking distance of great restaurants and the famous Pikes Market. Anything outside of walking distance is an easy cab ride assisted by a very happy bell hop. There is a Starbucks on site... great, and a fully stocked general store for anything you forgot to smoked salmon souvenirs. The in room dining is expensive, but it really is fantastic. They’ll bring little special things like yogurt smoothies. The views from the room are fun, and the staff is pleasant. They've changed the onsite restaurant to a Ruth's Chris since my last stay, but the set up and happy staff is the same. I would highly recommend if on business or pleasure. The comfy beds and great house music will set you in the mood to work or have fun. Plus, you can swing by the front desk for an apple any time you get a hunger pang.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesleyVW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary Jan 28th. Loved the hotel, we were upgraded to a corner suite on the 25th floor without even asking. Everything about the rooms was top grade, especially the bathroom. The service was first class. We chose to self park ($22.00 per day), valet parking is $33.00. We took a cab to the Triple Door in the evening ($3.50) and we walked back to the hotel afterwards, it's only a short walk and it wasn't raining for a change! We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The best I have ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: nalani65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights during our honeymoon the week after Christmas. The service, hotel and everything was exceptional! We decided to valet our car because the self park had no in and out privelages and the valet staff were very friendly and helpful! The staff greeted us every time they saw us and our room was beautiful, clean and more than we expected! The bathroom was huge and the black out drapes were great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially couples and honeymooners! It is also very close to a lot of shopping (Pacific Place, Westlake center, etc) We had a great time and we will definitely come back to stay here again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “High Class at Affordable Prices”
Reviews.Author: ChezPoulet
Reviews.Content: A standard room at this hotel is like an upgrade compared to others. The standard double queen room is about the size of any standard hotel room anywhere else, but the furnishings are beautiful and classy. The hotel and rooms have gorgeous lighting. Even in the entry way of the room, there is a sconce of amber marble that softly lights your return in the evening. The bathroom is a dream for those longing for a real soak in a tub. The tub is just right for soaking and the water covers your whole body. The shower is huge, enclosed in glass and the shower head has multiple spray settings and is high enough for someone over six feet to enjoy. Bathrobes, lots of soft towels and lovely bath soaps, gel, shampoo and conditioner. Good complimentary coffee and teas. The beds are comfortable with down toppers, pillows and comforters. Don't let the mini bar scare you. If you touch anything, but don't use it, you can let the front desk know that you did not use the item. Just avoid it if you don't plan on using anything and ask for a complimentary mini frige to be hooked up in the bathroom for you for your own beverages you can get at any drugstore or mini mart in town. I recommend you get the Regency Club upgrade. With this option, you get a key to enter the club on the 27th floor 24 hours a day to get coffee, tea, cocoa and soft drinks. Continental breakfast and afternoon snacks are offered. They're not substantial, but they're a nice little touch to stave off hunger before lunch or dinner. I found the staff from valet to housekeeping to be quite friendly, quick and attentive. We were there when the hotel was not busy. This hotel is right in the middle of downtown and once you valet your car, you don't need it to have a great vacation (yes, the valet service is expensive, so be prepared to pay $29-35.00 per day to park your car). This hotel does not nickle and dime, they are up front about their charges and do not charge any more than any other big city hotel. This is not Motel 6 folks! One concierge, Mr. Rice, has lots of advice on where to eat or play in town. The only cons about my stay is that the noise the rain makes on the windows is loud and the 5 Fwy. is noisy from any hotel that is within earshot of it. I give it 4.5 stars because it's not perfect, but close! I will stay here again. The best way to get the best prices to stay here is to go directly to the Hyatt web site and get their pre-paid reservation. You will lose out if you cancel, so only book if you're sure you're going to stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Grand Hyatt Seattle”
Reviews.Author: PSBTEXAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Downtown Seattle Grand Hyatt December 8th - December 11th. As it was a special occasion we decided to take the advise of another reviewer and booked an Emerald Suite for our stay. All we can say is WOW! What a wonderful room and view. We were on the 29th floor and our corner room windows had views of Puget Sound with the ferries coming and going, the Olympics & the Cascade Mountains, and the Space Needle. Looking out on to the downtown all decorated for the holidays was truly lovely. What a great location too. Pacific Place (shopping mall) is right across the street and is attached to the flagship Nordstrom by sky bridge. I liked the fact that we had coffee and tea making facilities in our room even though there was a Starbucks in the lobby. Convenient for breakfast. If you are looking to go a little extra it is worth getting the hotel to book you driver to pick you up at the airport. The company they use are exceptional and what a nice way to travel. If I were to find any fault with the hotel it would have to be with the concierges. Although they were all very nice they weren't as up on the city as I felt they should be. This however did not really effect our stay. We would highly recommend staying in this hotel and hope to return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler100
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt for 6 nights in early November and loved it. We booked an air/hotel package through Travelocity so I wasn't expecting a great room, but we got exactly what we asked for - King size bed, non-smoking, high floor (21st), facing the water and Pike Street Market. Desk staff and bellmen were all very friendly and helpful, which made our introduction to Seattle all that much nicer after a tiring day of flying there from Baltimore. The lobby is darkish and modern, which to me means welcoming. The room was in very good shape, like it had been renovated very recently. Overall, the room was about as spacious as I expected - pretty much standard size. Bathroom was large with a great shower enclosed by glass and a bathtub with fancy, expensive waterfall-type faucets if that's your kind of thing. The cleaning lady left us a note thanking us for the tips we left her, which I thought was a nice thing to do. The bed was soft (which I liked) and huge. The location of the hotel is central, close to lots of downtown shopping and restaurants (many of which are chains, but you're also a five minute walk from the Union Square Grill on Union St., which was delicious and relatively inexpensive (compared to D.C. prices, at least). A few things to note: 1. the pillows could have been bigger and fluffier. There were only 3 smallish pillows for both of us. 2. when we stayed at the hotel, we could valet park for $33 per day or self-park in the exact same lot for $22 per day. Needless to say, we self-parked. 3. the doors to the rooms slam if they're not held when they're closing, and the slamming sometimes had the effect of shaking all the walls in our room, which was a little annoying. It never woke us up, however. If we ever go back to Seattle, we will definitely stay at the Hyatt again. I've posted a few photos of the bed and the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seattle over the Colombus day Weekend for 4 nights. We felt so welcome and important. The valet service made the first and best impression. They were always smiling and attentive. The front desk was very quick and prompt. Our suite was classy and housekeeping was prompt. Defintley recommend it to all your readers.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping, Dining & Entertainment Center - Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: SPCTCC
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Seattle is one classy place. My honey and I stayed 3 nights and enjoyed everything about it. Clean and wonderfully appointed. The enormous bathroom and soaking tub, the fitness gym, on-site restaurants and location next to shops and cafes galore couldn't have been better. The brief walk to the bay and Pikes Market - wow!!! Highly recommend this one to couples needing a break from the rat race.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Find and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt during the weekend of Sept 17th. I'm not one to gush about hotels (being a bit of a hotel snob), but this hotel significantly exceeded my expectations (and I have no agenda in writing this review). The Grand Hyatt is brand new (only 4 years old) with atractive marble and light wooden appointments. The hotel benefits from having (1) an excellent location 7 blocks from Pike Place Market, (2) well-appointed and spacious rooms and (3) a friendly and helpful hotel staff. The worst thing I could say about the hotel is that the concierge desk was average. Also, as a member of the Starwood rewards program, I've stayed at the W Seattle (extremely mediocre guest service and extremely mediocre rooms) in the past and the Grand Hyatt kicks it up and down the block. I wouldn't come to any hotel with expectations of being treated like royalty, but the Grand Hyatt is a top-notch premium hotel in a very cool city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in a "Corner Suite" over Labor Day weekend and overall enjoyed a very peaceful and relaxing stay. PROS... - Location: The hotel is located in a great location. We didn't rent a car and were able to walk to the waterfront, Pike's Place, Chinatown, Qwest Field and Pioneer Square. There's also a free shuttle that circles the downtown area. Tons of restaurants and shops are located throughout the area and the mall that's kitty-corner from the hotel. - Service: We received a friendly greeting from every employee who saw us. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. Room and maid service were excellent! This is one of the few hotels I've stayed at were housekeeping understands what "do not disturb" means and doesn't make lots of noise while they're cleaning the other rooms. - Beds: These have to be one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept on. Although if your allergic to down you may want to look elsewhere since everything is down-filled (pillows, comforter, & mattress pad). - Decor: The decor of the rooms is beautiful, very modern and comfortable. We also had great blinds to block out the sun, which is great if you like to sleep in like us. - View: We had a great view of the bay (see attached pics) and the downtown area. We were able to tell what to wear and how busy it was just by looking out our window. - Star-gazing: We ran into 4-5 Vikings' players shortly before the game on Friday. CONS (very minor)... - Room size: We had a corner suite which basically has 3 separate rooms in about 400 sq. feet, so there's not alot of room to move around. This really only posed a problem for us when we were packing, unpacking, and getting ready to go out. - Smell: There was a very minor meat/grease smell throughout the hotel, my husband didn't even notice. I think it may be from the restaurant (Ruth Chris Steakhouse), but it carried all the way to our 26th floor hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Julie9409
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Grand Hyatt Seattle after spending a night there for our 10th anniversary. We made the reservation online and booked an executive level room with access to the Regency Club, which we would highly recommend. Our room was on the 24th floor and we had a view of Lake Union to the north and the city to the east. The Regency Club is on the 27th floor, and serves free continental breakfast (fresh squeezed OJ!), has free beverages (soda and coffee) throughout the day, and serves free hors d'eourves from 5-8:30 p.m. If you can fork out the extra cash for the Regency Club level, do it! My husband is active duty military and so we received the government rate of $168, and it was worth every penny! A Gene Juarez spa is a block away, and while I was getting a massage, my husband created a very romantic setting in the room - roses that had been delivered to the hotel earlier in the day, and chilled champagne and chocolate and strawberries prepared by room service. The staff was exceptional - the bell hop gave us some interesting facts - the marble used in the entry way and bathroom is fossilized so "if you look really close you might be able to see something." In the morning when I called the front desk to find out when check-out was, the guy answered the phone and said, "Good Morning, Mrs. Callahan, how can I help you?" The room was exquisite - feather topped mattress and down comforter, marble entryway and bathroom, and a waterfall faucet in the tub. Even a Starbucks in the lobby- score! Also a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse (best steaks in the world) in the hotel. We called down to the valet about five minutes before we checked out, and our vehicle was waiting outside for us. But it's true about the mini-bar, don't touch it unless you want to eat it or drink it, because it is computerized and you'll get charged for it! We didn't find this out the hard way - our bell hop gave us the low down. A great shopping distict is a block away or take a short walk or free bus ride to the Pikes Place Market about seven blocks away. All in all a fantastic hotel and one of the best Seattle has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably horrible! Worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for an Emerald Suite at the Grand Hyatt for the night prior to and the night of our July 1 wedding. Several times prior to the date of check-in, my husband called to confirm various details (we wanted a bottle of champagne on ice for our July 1 wedding night, etc.). I checked in to the hotel on the day prior to our wedding. I requested the specific suite we looked at, which had a view of the Space Needle and the water. We were told we could not request a specific room until check-in, and when I did request it at check-in, I was told that was the room we had. It was not. We had a water and a city view. Still a nice view, but not at all what we had expected or were promised (the Space Needle and water view was requested). When we asked the bellboys (there were 2 standing around and no other guests in the lobby at the time) to help us with our bags, which were in our car in the garage, they argued as to who had to help us. Finally, one lost the argument and escorted us with a cart to our car. Upon arriving at our car, without saying a word the whole way, the bellboy threw our luggage onto the cart and haphazardly threw my wedding dress on top of it all. He then proceeded to bang the cart into the wall twice on the way back down to the lobby with no apology. When we got to the lobby, my mother asked him to step away from the cart and not touch our stuff. He started to argue with her. We got a different bellboy to take our items up to my room. When I got to the room I discovered that not only were we not given the room we had asked for (and been told we received), but the champagne for the wedding night was waiting on ice on the coffee table. I took it off the ice, called the appropriate number and asked them to please re-place it on ice on Friday, the night of our wedding. The night prior to the wedding, I ordered room service. A very simple order. After waiting for almost an hour for the food to arrive, it was incorrect. On our wedding night, my husband and I returned to the room to find the champagne where I had left it the day prior, on the end table next to the couch...no ice. At 8:53AM on the morning after our wedding, housekeeping rang the doorbell to the suite. Check out was not until noon. This was the part that upset me the most. 8:53 am the morning after our wedding! Not only did housekeeping ring the doorbell (the door to the suite is on the opposite end and in another room than the bedroom), they proceeded to enter. Repeat, this is the morning after our wedding. Ah! Needless to say, at this point we were ready to vacate this room that we paid way, way too much money for. The bellboy arrived to help with our baggage and it was the one from the day before that I had had such a bad experience with. He took our luggage and rolled it outside to the valet area. He left it and did not tell the valet which car it was to be loaded into (meanwhile, we were inside checking out). Upon check-out, I shared these experiences with the employee at the desk, he apologized and credited the room service back. After all of the various mess-ups that occurred, I will never stay at that hotel again. Not only that, but whenever I drive by it (I am from the Seattle area), I will be reminded of what a horrible experience I had there in the days surrounding my wedding. Thankfully, my husband and I were too happy with each other to let it ruin our wedding night. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. I cannot even express on here how deeply this whole experience disappointed us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate room, billing all screwed up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here a on business couple of weeks ago. The room was OK, although the bedding is full of feathers (pillows, mattress pad) so I had to expressly request that housekeeping not put back the pillowtop mattress pad. Huge bathroom, actually unneccessarily large for my needs. The minibar is computerized, so if you even move something to see what it is you'll be charged for it. Biggest problem was on checkout day, when I had breakfast in the restaurant and checked out before the cost was posted to my account. They faxed me a copy of my receipt, then double-charged me for the breakfast. It's been a week and a half and it still isn't straightened out. Odd for a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt..”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtwin
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early evening in Seattle and stayed at the Grand Hyatt and loved the location! The staff at the front reception as well as the doorman that delivered sunglasses left in the rental car that went to valet parking as soon as we requested them were in the true Hyatt tradition of service. We had room service the next morning and everything was delivered perfectly - we would recommend this hotel to all our familly and friends when visiting Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Content: Just completed a one night stay at the Grand Hyatt Seattle. We were very happy with everything and can't complain. The staff was professional and courteous. Everyone from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff was friendly and always greeted us.Jason checked us in immediately and was extremely nice, efficient, and welcoming. The house keeping staff does a great job in keeping the rooms clean. The decor was modern, the bathrooms beautiful. We were upgraded at no additional charge to a corner suite, maybe because of our Platinum status or maybe because it was a monday. The view was amazing and we loved the electronic blinds and huge room. There is a great shuttle run by Gray Line that takes you to the hotel for 17 dollars round trip, 10.25 one way. We only took the shuttle from the hotel which left at 15 minutes past the hour and 45 minutes past the hour. It was right on time and took less than 45 minutes including two stops at other hotels prior to arriving at the airport. Much cheaper than a 30-40 dollar plus tip cab ride. We have gone to the restaurant Brooklyn on this trip and our last trip also. The entertainment book provides a buy one get one free coupon for it and the food although pricey is worth it. The entertainment book provides many buy one get one free coupons to local attractions including the art museum, Victoria Clipper, aquarium, and others. The hotel is in a good location to attractions and shopping.Pikes market is a straight 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. It is right next door to an awesome movie theatre and the Cheese Cake factory. If you can get a great deal this is a hotel that I would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!! Hands down the best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location - Central downtown Price - Reasonable for the quality of the hotel Rooms - Huge bathrooms are the highlight but everything is brand new Service - Great What it lacks - no pool Overall - The Grand Hyatt is amazing and the only place I'd stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoblanoJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a large conference at the convention center a block away. I found the rooms to be comfortable and ample. The bathroom was huge, with separate bathtub and enclosed shower. The room was impeccably clean. Front desk staff was very accommodating. Every request (extra hangers, extra towels, a refrigerator in the room, etc.) was fulfilled quickly and cheerfully with a follow-up phone call to the room making sure the service had met our needs. Also, for those attending a conference, you can get from the hotel to the convention center without getting wet when it rains (which it does do in Seattle) thanks to some creative architecture. I would stay at this hotel again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed at this trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 young children and I stayed in a one bedroom suite from the 19th-21st and absolutely loved it. The lobby was grand and their guest service people were very helpful. We definitely had more than enough space for the 5 of us in this very big very nice room. We had a panoramic view of the city and the ocean and I felt very safe knowing that the windows would not pop open (which I experienced at another hotel in a different city this trip.) It was a close walk to the market and we spent all day (albeit a rainy day) down at the piers. All in all, a great location, a great hotel, we will definitely recommend this hotel to others!!! I mean seriously- Who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “A terrific weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel but let the nitpicking begin.... Construction is underway outside the hotel front and naturally we got a room facing that side. Luckily minimal impact as we were out all day, but consider that issue. Downtown Seattle must be ridden with police cruisers since I counted a least a half dozen sirens heard thoughout the first night, hey it was Friday so who can say? Rooms have gigantic bathrooms. Beds are pillowtopped on steroids. So much so that if you sleep anywere other than middle of the bed you will feel like you will fall off. Also any movement by one partner will result in jello like quivering of the bed which my wife certainly did not enjoy. Had room service which was really tasty and hot. Chili is great! Only restaurant in the hotel is Ruths Chris which is awesome to satisfy any carnivore but probably vegans will have to just get steamed broccoli. Kids were welcome and the staff was very nice. Weird that the hotel really doesn't have a lounge unless you count the Ruth's, and Ruths is not a place I usually go for a drink. Luckily the hotel across the street has a nice bar. Close to all the shops. If you want to shop this is the place to use as your base of ops. If you are a groupie the Cleveland Indians stayed here our weekend. Gym is nice but strange, huge machine area but lots of wasted space. Minimal weight equipment but it is very modern nice stuff. Great house staff, appropriate level of care and attentiveness. Belllguys remembered my kids all weekend and were super nice to them. (Did not see a lot of kids in this place however). Valet guys are great. All in all a great weekend and would stay here again. Wife wishes they had a pool and a proper lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent an evening at the Grand Hyatt and we were absolutely impressed with the service and restraunts. Arrived late in the evening and immediately went to dinner after check in. Our bags and a roll away bed were in our room when we returned. Upgraded our room to a suite on the 30th floor. Room was immaculate with an excellent view. King bed was very comfortable and the linen soft. Very large bathroom and sitting room. Several restraunts, Ruth's Cris & Cheese Cake Factory, minutes from the hotel. GrayLine airport shuttle stops right at the hotel which is very convienent. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt Seattle has it all...”
Reviews.Author: azrambler
Reviews.Content: ... We were greatly impressed during our stay at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle, WA. Design, technology, and service converge to create an entirely enjoyable experience for guests. When one enters the guestroom, it is as if one is entering into a luxurious apartment, complete with a doorbell and foyer.
